Job Description
Ford is looking for talented, career-oriented people to be our next generation of leaders.
If you have...

A Passion for Learning: For you, every job is a chance to grow and apply what you know.
An Adventurous Spirit: You look at a career as a series of exciting opportunities that can take you across the country or around the world.
A Desire to Have an Impact: Whether its through supporting your communities or reaching personal goals, you thrive on making a difference.
A Distinctive Personality: Youre someone who embraces your individuality and appreciates the uniqueness in your teammates. ...then Ford Global Data, Insight and Analytics may be the RIGHT PLACE to discover and pursue your dreams for success.

Who We Are:
We are trusted advisors enabling Ford to see our business, know our customers, and act in a meaningful way. We enable evidence based decision making by providing timely, actionable, and forward-looking insights to our Ford business partners.

Opportunities include, but are not limited to:
Leveraging the latest techniques in machine learning and big data to model internal and external data sources
Forecasting vehicle sales and marketing outcomes
Analyzing and optimizing marketing activities
Leading new initiatives in the areas of autonomous vehicles and sustainability
Supporting connectivity and mobility solutions
Data development and management including transactional and 3 rd party data sources
Developing and implementing analytics models and visualization tools for Manufacturing Processes and Supply Chain Management
Developing and operationalizing data standards, quality and governance across the enterprise
Developing new data sources and analytic methods
Working with large data sets from multiple sources and create visualizations to answer key business questions
Researching and developing models to quantify exposure to various sources of risk (credit, residual, market, operations, regulatory, and compliance)
Creating analytics for Manufacturing, Purchasing, Product Development, Human Resources, Legal, and other areas of the business where data can drive improvements Minimum Qualifications:

Students graduating from a Bachelors, Masters, or PhD program with a concentration in a quantitative field such as Math, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Engineering, or Physics
GPA of at least 3.0 on a 4.0 Scale (or equivalent)
Expected graduation date is no later than June 2018 Preferred Qualifications:

Strong oral and written communication skills
Experience with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint and Word
Demonstrated skills in large scale data manipulation, machine learning, and mining / pattern recognition
Critical thinking skills that demonstrate the ability to use existing and discoverable data to solve business problems
Familiarity with topics such as maximum likelihood estimation, linear and non-linear modeling, causal inference, density estimation, optimization, scheduling, time series forecasting, stochastic processes, survival analysis, data blending and data visualization, multivariate techniques such as PCA, factor analysis, and cluster analysis
Ability to translate complex quantitative methods into easily understood results for all levels of business customers
Ability to handle multiple projects within a given timeframe
Experience with tools such as Hadoop, Alteryx, QlikView, Tableau, Apache, Spark, Caffe or other deep-learning libraries
Strong programming skills; Experience in R, Python, SAS, SQL or Matlab The distance between imagination and . Creation. It can be measured in years of innovation, or in moments of brilliance. And, it can be a road you start traveling right now. When you join Ford Motor Company, your journey begins. You become part of a team that is already leading the way, with ingenious solutions and attainable products  and it is always ready to go further.

Candidates for positions with Ford Motor Company must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.

Ford Motor Company is an equal opportunity employer committed to a culturally diverse workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status or protected veteran status.

Job Description:
Provides technical systems and software support for maintenance, modification, implementation, or conversion of business systems to support ongoing delivery of services and/or operations in the Global Markets environment. Aware of business or function for which application or system is designed. Translates business needs into technical requirements and ensures all systems support and conform to business needs and specifications. Serves as a fully seasoned and proficient technical resource. Individual contributor role; fully competent to work under general direction on complex projects usually on specific assigned problems. Entry level position. This job code is only to be used for employees supporting Global Markets.

Responsibilities:
The liquidity risk technology team provides global solution to Global Liquidity Management Line of Business within Corporate Treasury.

A Business Analyst/Technical Architect is required to join the Liquidity Risk technology team in New Jersey. The person will come with strong analytical skills with a strong hands on technology background primarily in developing and supporting data and reporting solutions.

Analyze various data and system issues and engage with business users and technology team to investigate, and resolve BAU issues.
Pro-actively learn the application and become a SME to help in the integration of technology within the business work flow.
Understand end to end data and system architecture to manage impact of external (e.g. regulatory) or internal upstream system changes on data/reporting platform in collaboration with various stakeholders.
Liaise with development team to manage the delivery of software components for the ongoing enterprise initiatives
Write technical design, user guide and testing specification as required

Required Skills:
Strong business analysis & software architecture skills obtained in a large enterprise environment.
Essential Technology Skills - Excel / VBA, SQL, ETL, Data migration/transformation, data architecture & design, and reporting/BI tools
Knowledge of data modelling, database designs and SQL is essential.
Past background in implement data migrations and transformation projects is highly desirable.
Ability to document and present system and data flows using industry standard tools and methodologies such as Microsoft Visio, Power point, UML etc.
Strong knowledge of end to end software development life cycle, system implementation and standard methodologies such as Agile or Scrum
Candidates with some Project Management, communication and presentation skills will be given preference.
Candidates with prior experience in banking, risk or regulatory environment will be given preference
Background in implementing data driven reporting solutions
Comfortable in dealing with large data and analytics (Excel skills are essential for this role)
Experience in stakeholder management, system testing, and quality assurance, writing functional specific and business requirements and be able to talk to business as well as developers
Any background in technologies such as Microsoft.NET or JAVA will be a plus
Ability to work independently and take responsibility and task ownership

Shift: 1st shift (United States of America)

Hours Per Week: 40

Job Search Identifier
Staff

Proposed Salary
$42,257.00

Booz Allen Hamilton has been at the forefront of strategy and technology for more than 100 years. Today, the firm provides management and technology consulting and engineering services to leading Fortune 500 corporations, governments, and not-for-profits across the globe. Booz Allen partners with public and private sector clients to solve their most difficult challenges through a combination of consulting, analytics, mission operations, technology, systems delivery, cybersecurity, engineering and innovation expertise.
Data Analyst
Key Role:
Provide data analysis and data visualization support to federal government clients. Analyze and execute efficient and effective processes for compiling, managing, analyzing, and reporting data. Develop informative and intuitive data visualizations and dashboards. Address business challenges, perform analysis, and provide solutions to the problem with data-driven products. Conduct market research, analyze, develop, and organize information, develop client deliverables, and attend or participate in client meetings. Prepare written material for guidance documents, presentations, and other ad hoc documents.
Basic Qualifications:
-2+ years of experience with data analytics
-Experience with Microsoft Excel
-Experience with one or more dashboarding applications, including Tableau
-Experience with developing written reports and documents
-Ability to develop deliverables, recommendations, and analysis independently
-Ability to obtain a security clearance
-BA or BS degree
Additional Qualifications:
-Experience with supporting federal clients
-Experience with other Microsoft Office tools, including PowerPoint preferred
-Ability to work on multiple projects, multi-task, manage time effectively, and demonstrate flexibility in responding to conflicting deadlines or priorities
-Possession of excellent data gathering, analytical, and problem-solving skills
-Possession of excellent client-facing and consulting skills
-Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills, including discussing data and analysis

Clearance:
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
Integrating a full range of consulting capabilities, Booz Allen is the one firm that helps clients solve their toughest problems by their side to help them achieve their missions. Booz Allen is committed to delivering results that endure.
We are proud of our diverse environment, EOE, M/F/Disability/Vet.

Immediate Need

Will be assisting on a disaster recovery project

Responsibilities:
Extracting data from software programs by creating programming scripts to create reports for business needs
Apply data and data points and assemble extracted data into appropriate reporting by business unit
Logically analyze data reporting process and create reports identifying issues
Integration of SQL data with other information repositories and/or reporting tools
Required Skills:
Strong data analytical experience
Strong SQL Server skills
Experience creating programming scripts to extract data and create reports
Reporting expertise with SQL databases  Business operations knowledge
Effective analytical skills to apply to relevant problems
Must have OnBase knowledge and experience, especially with the SQL server version
Required Qualifications:
Bachelors Degree
Preferred Qualifications:
Masters Degree

The Leukemia & Lymphoma Society (LLS) currently uses multiple systems (both siloed and integrated) for tracking constituent and related transactional data across its many functional areas (Campaigns, Patient Access, Research, Donor Development). Primary systems include a complex proprietary system (M360), and multiple instances of Salesforce.com. Additional systems may include external data repositories such as the LLS Copay system, Dun & Bradstreet, and NCOA/Death Supression data. LLS is looking for a hands-on technologist and architect who has deep experience in Information management, data warehousing, MDM strategy, and analytics technologies to provide us with direction in the areas of business intelligence analytics, data mining and visualization and assessment of data quality and consistency across platforms, products and geographical areas. The candidate will lead data strategy implementation efforts jointly with Enterprise Architecture and IT Client Service Teams and augment LLSs knowledge of the underlying data and data products. The Data Analyst is the subject matter expert on content, current and potential future uses of data, and the quality and interrelationship between core elements of the data repository and data products. The Enterprise Data Architect will consult with information technology, data analytics, product creation and development staff to design and implement scripts, programs, databases, software components and analyses that will support product quality and an in depth understanding of potential uses of the data. The Enterprise Data Architect has business responsibility for determining the information the enterprise will capture, retain and exploit. This individual will possess a combination of business knowledge, technical skills, and people skills to define and guide data strategy.
Reports to: Head of IT
Responsibilities
Duties and Responsibilities:
Management and technical detail responsibility with responsibility for leading the effort to establish a Master Data Management (MDM) strategy
Senior level data architect will serve as the technical resource lead in the strategic oversight, planning of data models, database structural design and delivery roadmaps.
Defines and implements the strategy roadmap for enterprise data, implementation and data management for new data sources, publicly available data, business-to-business partnerships and advanced Data Analytics systems.
Will be responsible for developing and owning the enterprise data model which will encompass a dual architecture, including Salesforce and proprietary systems used within the organization.
Provides technical, strategic advice and guidance of state-of-the-art data technology, tools, and vendors (including managed packages) to support the development of a LLS Data Strategy, its technical implementation, resourcing, and the creation and implementation of new data standards and databases.
Develops data and metadata policies and procedures for structural design and development to build, maintain and leverage the data model, ensuring integration with corporate data standards.
Strategically plans new designs for integration into a database structure, using knowledge of the characteristics of the systems being added to the structure and the specifications for database interfaces to ensure effective integration and improving database performance.
Provides advanced technical direction to the maintenance of major existing databases supporting evolving applications and business processes.
Establishes standards and guidelines for the design & development, tuning, deployment and maintenance of information, advanced data analytics, text mining models and physical data persistence technologies.
Works with staff and customers to understand the business requirements and business processes, design data warehouse (DW) schema and define extract-translate-load (ETL) and/or extract-load-translate (ELT) processes for DW.
Candidate will play an important role in setting the IT Architecture vision and will be working with businesses to improve data business practices, and should have experience in performing vendor and product evaluations.
Ability to translate broader business initiatives into strategy and tactical objectives; ability to manage initiatives/ projects to successful conclusion
Beneficial if candidate has knowledge of advanced data analysis tools, including statistical analysis, data mining techniques, and use of computational packages such as SAS, R or SPSS
Develops specific metrics for quality and consistency reviews of data across departments and chapter.
Education & Experience Requirements:
Minimum of Bachelors Degree (Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Industrial Engineering).Advanced degree in
Applied Mathematics, Business Analytics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Computer Science or related fields is a plus.
A minimum of 10 years of progressively responsible experience in a directly related area, during which both professional and management capabilities have been clearly demonstrated.
Ideal candidate will have at least 2 years as a SFDC Data Architect with 2 or more successful custom Salesforce.com solutions spanning multiple platforms, including integration, data migration, and authentication/Roles based access control. SFDC certifications a plus
Experience with mass retail data is a plus
Must have experience working with multiple business units using numerous technology platforms with incongruent data models
Extensive experience developing conceptual and logical data models for enterprise systems as well as with multidimensional data modeling, such as star schemas, snowflakes, normalized and de-normalized models, handling slow-changing dimensions/attributes.
Extensive experience providing practical direction on information and analytics platforms in conjunction with EDW tools and technologies.
Solid experience with Data Warehouse and BI systems.
Knowledge of relational SQL databases and SQL (including SQL Server tables, triggers, unions, joins, complex queries and stored procedures) in at least one of the following environments: Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL.
Proven success in the design and implementation of enterprise data integration solutions and technologies.
In depth knowledge of ETL tools and/or Data Integration products (e.g. Pervasive, Informatica, WebMethods, Castiron, Biztalk).
Knowledge of cloud computing and considerations for scalable, distributed systems.
Qualifications
Position Requirements & Skills:
Possess excellent written and oral communication skills with the ability to explain technical issues clearly and accurately to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Ability to use logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to complex problems.
Ability to work independently, establishing strategic objectives, project plans and milestone goals.
Ability to engage directly with a very wide of stakeholders in mission, operations, management, oversight and development roles, as well as volunteers, as needed.
Self-starter with the ability to multi-task in a fast paced work environment.
Must be organized and detail oriented.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Ability to work collaboratively as a member of a team, regardless of the task at hand.
Takes independent actions and calculated risks, looks for and takes advantages of opportunities, solicits feedback to improve processes or actions.
Makes rational and realistic decisions which are based on logical assumptions, reflects factual information and shows consideration of organizational resources.
Uses appropriate interpersonal styles and methods in guiding individuals or groups.
Demonstrates stability of performance under pressure and/or opposition. Ability to cope with uncertainty, change and performance demands.
Establishes and develops effective relations. Exhibits utmost tact and consideration.
Anticipates long term opportunities, defines a desired future state and communicates direction of vision and values.
Incorporates long-term goals into tangible results and day-to-day activities; reinforces with the team.
Facilitates the development of others knowledge and skills, providing timely feedback and guidance to help them reach goals.

NFL Summer Internship Program participants have the opportunity to contribute to the organization's success while receiving an unmatched, behind-the-scenes learning experience. Though interns work within specific departments, they are able to explore all aspects of the business of professional football through challenging project assignments, speaker presentations, mentoring relationships, and networking opportunities.

Internship Details:
The Analyst, International Intern, Digital Media will be responsible for assisting with report requirement gathering, creation and delivery. Responsibilities will involve web/mobile/OTT/social analytics reporting and analyses, media research/benchmarking, automated dashboards and analytics architecture.

The Analyst, International will be a highly-motivated, results-oriented contributor to an exceptional team and will report directly to the Director, Media Intelligence.

Program Details:
The summer program covers a minimum of 8 weeks, from Monday, June 4, 2018 through Friday, July 27, 2018. Please note that some departments may require their interns to work past the official end date. If so, this will be communicated to the applicant during the interview process. Interns will be required to work five (5) full days (approximately 40 hours) per week. Interns will be paid an hourly rate for their work.

Application Details & Deadline:
In addition to submitting your resume and completing your online profile, you will be required to answer the following essay questions:

How will your participation in this program contribute to your long-term career objectives?
The NFL's core values are Integrity, Resiliency, Respect, and Responsibility to Team. Please choose one of our values, define it in your own words, and give an example of a time that you have exemplified that value in your educational or professional life.
A completed application constitutes the completion and submission of all relevant fields in the profile, including the program specific questions and rsum. Applications must be submitted no later than Friday, January 5, 2018 at 11:59 PM EST. No exceptions will be made for those who miss the application deadline.

Due to the high volume of applicants, only those selected for interviews will be contacted. If you are not selected, you will receive an email notification. Please do not contact the NFL regarding the status of your application.

Must have completed a minimum of three years in an accredited four-year college/university degree program
A minimum GPA of at least 3.0. Academic transcripts (official or unofficial) will be requested
Prior experience in and passion for digital marketing with an understanding of the digital ecosystem (including social media trends)
Coursework in marketing or digital media not required but preferred
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint
Highly detail-oriented, analytical and results-driven with the ability to make decisions based on empirical data
Self-starter with proven ability to work effectively with others in matrix organization
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment as well as adapt to continually changing priorities and aggressive deadlines
Outstanding verbal/written communication and organizational skills
Passionate team player
Strong interest in the NFL and experience playing fantasy football desired
Equal Opportunity Employer Minorities/Women/Protected Veterans/Disabled

Together at Talkdesk, were building a future of brilliant customer interactions. We have the cleverness, curiosity, and grit to make us a team of customer heroes: thinkers, achievers, and dreamers who believe that our world-class SaaS platform can influence a new kind of customer interaction.

Talkdesk started from a hackathon win and within five years has become one of the fastest growing companies in the world, a Forbes Next Billion Dollar Startup, and has enabled 100,000,000+ customer interactions using our platform. With backing from DFJ, Salesforce Ventures, and Storm Ventures, and supported by the successes of our 1,200+ customers from DoorDash, Box, Betterment to Shopify, Talkdesk is disrupting a $22 billion stagnant market.

Were now looking for the new members of the Talkdesk family - those ambitious, driven, and collaborative individuals who thrive in a fast-paced environment and will push us to do even greater things together. If you are a world-class Data Analyst and would like to help us shape the future of Talkdesk, come along with us on our journey - your dream job is waiting!

Responsibilities

Champion the use and application of data and analytics across the company

Partner with different departments (e.g. Sales, Success, Marketing, Business Operations, Product, etc.) to produce insights as an internal data consultant

Identify strategic opportunities, areas of improvement, and best practices within the team and across the organization

Design clever data models that balance the diverse, specific needs of various business stakeholders with general principles of flexibility and extensibility

Collaborate with Engineering to collect and process data, develop business tools, and enable new insights

Establish data governance by setting standards for the consistent definition and application of metrics

Requirements

2 or more years of experience in a Data Insights, Data Analytics, Data Science or Business Analytics role

Proficiency in SQL (Postgres preferred, but not required)

Formidable Excel or R skills

Experience with business intelligence tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau)

Expertise with statistical analyses and concepts (e.g. regressions, experiment design, etc.)

Background in handling very large (1TB+) data sets (optional, but highly preferred)

Strategically-minded yet detail-oriented

Excellent interpersonal communication and presentation skills

BA/BS degree in a related field (Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering)

The Talkdesk story hinges on empathy and acceptance. It is the shared goal among all Talkdeskers to empower a new kind of customer hero through our innovative software solution, and we firmly believe that the best path to success for our mission is inclusivity, diversity, and genuine acceptance. To that end, we will hire, promote, work along, cheer for, bond with, and warmly welcome into the Talkdesk family all persons without regard to ethnic and racial identity, indigenous heritage, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, marital status, veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected status.

Our Brand Protection solutions deliver a premiere suite of SaaS-based software, including our flagship CyberAnalyst technology. We protect our customers global brands online by seeking out sellers who:

Advertise counterfeit products

Infringe upon trademarks or copyrights

Sell products outside of authorized territories

Our customers rely on us to shut down illicit online listings worth millions of dollars each year.

The Data Analyst will:
Responsibilities

Utilize the CyberAnalyst rules engine to set up data collection and processing rules for assigned clients

Validate results

Perform additional web research related to suspect sellers and listings

Set up and maintain an interactive dashboard for clients to review results

Generate and deliver client-specific reports

Initiate online enforcement actions such as listing takedowns (e.g. from eBay, iOffer, Alibaba)

Conduct periodic global reviews of the Internet to identify new data sources for clients

Good working knowledge of the internet (advanced searching capabilities)

Strong analytical skills

Organized with attention to details; professional attitude and dependable

Good verbal and written communication skills

Ability to work independently, multi-task, and thrive in a fast-paced, start-up environment

Proficient in MS Office, in particular Excel spreadsheets

SQL skills preferred

BA/BS degree or in progress

Additional languages (read and write) are a plus

Basic industry background in Technology, high-end Electronics, or Consumer goods is a plus

At Revere Health, we value the health of our patients above all else. As the largest independent multi-specialty physician group in Utah, our healthcare system gives patients the best in communication, quality, coordination and innovation. Founded in 1960 in Provo, Utah, Revere Health has grown to include 29 medical specialties in over 100 locations throughout Utah, Arizona and Nevada.

As one of two Accountable Care Organizations accredited by Medicare in Utah, Revere Health offers a unique, patient-oriented approach to healthcare. We strive to keep medical costs at a minimum while providing the utmost in quality healthcare.

Revere Health : lets live better.

Purpose:

Data analyst will provide reporting tools for ongoing evaluation of the clinics operational processes, financial and patient health outcomes. Analyst will use real time clinical and financial data for predictive modeling and statistical analysis. This role requires the ability to effectively communicate ideas, findings and process improvements with internal and external customers such as physicians, administrators, and data requestors.

Responsibilities :
Recognize business trends to improve outcomes by understanding, reviewing and summarizing available data.
Produce, modify and test various complex SQL queries for data analysis and data questions
Develop SSIS Packages to present the data necessary to meet business requirements.
Collaborate with internal customers to design, create, test and implement analytic tools using SSRS.
Develops and/or uses algorithms and statistical predictive models and determines analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate potential future outcomes using R or SAS
Ability to validate integrity of data
Completely and clearly document all analytical methodologies
Train users on reporting systems tools and how to create new and use existing reports
Other duties as assigned
Required Skills and Experience:
Work experience with SQL, database management, R or SAS, Modeling Experience, Microsoft Reporting Services
Self-starter with strong work ethic and proven ability of oral and written communication skills
Demonstrated analytical abilities to aid in problem solving, decision making, with ability to manage multiple priorities on tight deadlines
Healthcare experience preferred

Position Description
Walmart Labs is seeking outstanding technologists for our Walmart Labs Retail Data Science team.

The mission of the Retail Data Science team:
WE ENGINEER SYSTEMS OF INTELLIGENCE AND ACTION TO AUTOMATE RETAIL DECISIONS AT SCALE

The team creates value for Walmart customers through researching and building complex, cutting edge, and scalable algos, models, platforms, and technologies. Our team of high caliber engineers, scientists, mathematicians, and statisticians develop rigorous quantitative methods to build efficient and effective algorithms that optimize decisions. We employ the wealth of Walmart data to build this portfolio of AI/ML models in a rapid test, learn, modify cycle. Our product teams include our business partners  directly. We see the outcomes of our work to enhance decisions every day.

We are seeking experts adept at partnering with the business, growing talented teams, and building capability development in tech. The ideal leader will combine expertise in AI/ML/Open Source/Tech knowledge, hands-on experience in algorithm planning, engineering, strategic capability development in AI/ML, and imparting keen understanding of revenue models and value creation.

The successful candidate will join a dynamic group of scientists developing breakthrough capabilities in retail, creating new scientific approaches, and innovating solutions using state-of-the-art technology  at Walmart scale.

Analyzes data to drive analytics projects
Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans
Models compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity
Participates in multiple analytics project teams
Presents data insights to key stakeholders
Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 3 years experience in an analytics related field, OR 5 years experience in analytics related field, OR a Masters degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 1 year experience in an analytics related field.

Additional Preferred Qualifications

3 years experience with SQL and relational databases (for example, DB2, Oracle, SQL Server).
3 years experience with statistical programming languages (for example, SAS, R).
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics and 4 years experience in an analytics related field.
Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or statistical analysis.
Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, or Mathematics.

Company Summary
What started small, with a single discount store and the simple idea of selling more for less, has grown over the last 50 years into the largest retailer in the world. Today, nearly 260 million customers visit our more than 11,500 stores under 72 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce sites in 11 countries each week. With fiscal year 2016 revenue of $482.1 billion, Walmart employs 2.3 million associates worldwide  1.5 million in the U.S. alone. Its all part of our unwavering commitment to creating opportunities and bringing value to customers and communities around the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data Science team. The ideal candidate would be an energetic, results focused self-starter with excellent analytical skills and an ability to decompose ambiguous questions into discrete data problems and answer with clear, actionable insights.
Key Responsibilities
Work with stakeholders in Growth, Marketing and Product to set and track meaningful KPIs
Work with Product Managers on exploratory analyses to find actionable info to drive growth
Develop standardized dashboards and ad hoc reports to inform decisions
Brainstorm new ideas and design experiments, test them, and analyze results

Requirements:
2+ years experience in product analytics, business intelligence, data analysis, data science, or similar area
Bachelors or Masters in Statistics, Math, Computer Science or other quantitative field (or equivalent experience)
Strong SQL skills are a must. Experience extracting, manipulating, and analyzing large data sets using SQL
Understanding of best practices in data visualization
Experience with data visualization and dashboard tools such as Tableau
Extremely attentive to detail, data accuracy, and quality of output
Experience with big data frameworks preferred
Bonus: Comfortable with statistics and common pitfalls in experimental design and analysis
Bonus: Some experience in a scripting language like Python a plus NOTE: Please complete the Data Analyst Screening Questions after your submission. The application will not be considered if the questionnaire is not completed.
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdPzuQxjSTdqh5Ba-EQDn6gWyNqoBfYUxVRdzo9J-qiULBL_Q/viewform?c=0&w=1

A few perks and benefits to whet your appetite:
Market competitive compensation package including stock options
Medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for employees

Domestic partner coverage
401(K) plan
Flexible time off
10 paid holidays
Free catered lunch, snacks and drinks

Paid gym membership
Onsite weekly massages available at a discounted rate
Employee Referral Program
Company sponsored speaker series: Learning about Learning
Happy hours, company outings and more
Open floor plan office with great views
The position is located in San Mateo, CA, right off the 101 freeway and the San Mateo Bridge.
How Edmodo is making a difference.
Our mission is to connect all learners to the people and resources needed to achieve their full potential. We are the world's leading global education network that provides communication, collaboration, and coaching tools for all members of the school community. We were founded in 2008 and currently have over 80 million members across 350,000+ schools in 150 countries.
The investors backing Edmodo are some of the best-recognized firms in the world, including Benchmark Capital, Greylock Ventures, Index Ventures, Union Square Ventures, Learn Capital and our Chairman is Reid Hoffman, founder of LinkedIn.
So join the team that is changing how teachers and students learn - change lives, build your career and rack up the karma.
Edmodo is an equal opportunity employer and does not unlawfully discriminate in employment. Equal access to employment, services, and programs is available to all persons. Those applicants requiring reasonable accommodation to the application and/or interview process should notify a representative of the organization.
Please note: Though submitting a resume to Edmodo implies that you are interested in a position(s), it does not imply that you are an applicant. You are not considered an applicant until you have been contacted directly by a Human Resources representative requesting that you begin the designated application process, which may involve phone and/or in-person interview(s), job-related testing, and background checking.

company_name: Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Mississippi
summary:
Job Summary The Provider Reimbursement Analyst is responsible and accountable for the assessment, analysis, summary and reporting of data related to providers and provider reimbursement programs. The Provider Reimbursement Analyst will utilize tools and access to defined data to produce detailed, well-written custom reports, including written analysis of key findings, charts, tables and graphs from aggregated data for use in assessment of reimbursement programs or to support reimbursement program development. The Provider Reimbursement Analyst will apply qualitative and quantitative techniques to interpret the data and produce substantiated recommendations.

The position is responsible for the maintenance support for provider reimbursement programs and for completing quality assurance tasks to ensure the quality of the data.

The position is responsible for gaining and maintaining an in-depth knowledge of provider data, the provider reimbursement programs, analytical models and supporting provider reimbursement systems.

Required Qualifications:
A degree in Mathematics, Health Informatics, Statistics, Science, Accounting or other discipline with a strong emphasis on data analysis and/or statistical methods.
Experience (professional or academic) in areas such as data collection (to include by means of an experiment), interruption and analysis including presentation of findings in a formal written report.
Experience with data tools such as SAS and SPSS preferred but not required
Prior Provider data or reimbursement knowledge preferred but not required
Excellent written work product skills as evidenced by prior experience
Demonstrated proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel, Word and PowerPoint

Blue Cross & Blue Shield of Mississippi is an Equal opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. We offer a comprehensive benefits package that is worth approximately one-third of the salary compensation. Our benefits program is among the best in the health care field. We are looking for employees who can bring their experience, expertise and dedication to work for our customers.

Summary: The individual in this position is responsible for building, distributing, and maintaining marketing dashboards that show delivery and return on investment determined from a defined set of key performance indicators. Orchestrate effort to organize tracking in HomeSuite iPad applications

Create meaningful reports to inform action with sales management

Verify outside tracking campaigns with partner agencies for accuracy

Direct marketing, unbranded websites, SEO efforts, etc.

Quarterly marketing performance review of all programs

Required Skills

Required Experience

Education: BA/BS Marketing or equivalent work experience

Experience: Minimum 3-5 years marketing experience

Opportunity at a Glance As the Business Reporting Analyst you are responsible for system and business process support of multiple systems. These systems are utilized by functional business groups across multiple higher education institutions.

You are successful in this position due to your experience supporting business processes and information systems for business groups - ideally in higher education. Your strong communication skills enable you to communicate with both technical and business-focused colleagues and leaders. You have knowledge of project management principles and the capacity to learn advanced systems, technology and technical environments. Utilizing your experience and skills enables you to optimize systems processes and improve business efficiencies.

Responsibilities Working as the Business Reporting Analyst, you will:
Provide regularly scheduled and ad hoc reports from assigned business systems.
Develop reports and dashboards using advanced reporting tools such as Cognos BI, MS Power BI and other business intelligence analytical tools.
Execute, maintain and deliver process requests.
Oversee the deliverables and Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for each of the systems you are responsible for. This could include: setting up system profiles, Q/A testing, tracking/forecasting call volumes and colleague activities, establishing omni-channel system campaigns and other tasks as needed.
Serve as the Subject Matter Expert and consultant resource, possessing good working knowledge of multiple business and system processes in one or more of the following areas: CRM, SIS, Student Finance/AR, Workforce Management, Telephony and Omni-channel systems.
Work and communicate with business leaders at all levels to identify needs. You will determine and recommend system and analytic solutions, as well as documenti data requirements.
Develop reports and/or system processes that support and optimize business performance.
Serve as liaison with technical teams in IT to communicate business needs, determine level of effort and prioritize against other initiatives. You contribute to drive processes and system improvements for various system enhancements.
Document and track activities associated with different academic partners
Completes other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Bachelors degree is required, and a Masters degree is desired.
Strong MS Office skills, especially with MS Excel.
3-5 years of customer service experience, preferably working in at least one of the following higher education areas: Admissions, Registrar Services, Student Finance or Academic Advising.
3-5 years of experience working with CRM, telephony, Workforce Management, SIS systems processes, call center technologies or similar applications is desired.
Capacity to learn technical systems and environments, and an interest in developing your technical skills.
Experience with project and/or change management is a plus.
Detailed-oriented with the ability to work independently, solve problems and drive to solutions.
Experience with coding and basic programming languages (e.t. SQL) for advanced analytical tools such as Cognos or Crystal reports is a plus.
Ability to work independently,
Good written and oral communication skills.

Who We Are The purpose of Adtalem Global Education is to empower students to achieve their goals, find success, and make inspiring contributions to our global community. Adtalem Global Education Inc. (NYSE: ATGE; member S&P MidCap 400 Index) is a leading global education provider and the parent organization of Adtalem Educacional do Brasil, American University of the Caribbean School of Medicine, Becker Professional Education, Carrington College, Chamberlain University, DeVry University and its Keller Graduate School of Management, Ross University School of Medicine and Ross University School of Veterinary Medicine. For more information, please visit adtalem.com.

Afiniti uses data science to enhance human interactions in large enterprises by efficiently pairing customers with company representatives. Our current main focus is improving contact center interactions in fields ranging from telecommunications to healthcare to banking to hospitality. To ensure were delivering value, we measure performance using a real-time control group  routing a portion of calls using the clients existing system and the majority of calls using our data-scientist-designed pairing strategies. Clients are billed on our incremental improvement, so model quality is central to our product. Challenges include understanding complex routing constraints, integrating multiple sources of data, and balancing utilization of agents with the system.

As a member of the AI production team, you will be responsible for building models that produce millions of dollars in customer value. This requires creative analysis to produce predictive models and to ensure the modeled pairing strategy is implemented correctly without unintended consequences. Understanding business logic is a vital part of the role to make sure were optimizing the correct metric. Youll work alongside our Business Analytics and ETL teams to ensure the data is up-to-date, accurate, and comprehensive and with our Client Services team to stay informed of changes, understand client concerns, and propose changes to the clients system that can produce further gain. Team members frequently develop and share tools for modeling, simulation, and monitoring.

This position is located in downtown Washington, DC and reports to the VP of AI Production North America.
Job Responsibilities and Requirements

Bachelors degree in Statistics, Operations Research, Computer Science, Math or another other technical/scientific field.

Experience in an analytical role extracting insights and value from quantitative data.

Excellent time-management skills and comfort working in a collaborative environment with cross-team and client communication.

Ability to build maintainable and well-documented modeling pipelines.

Communication and visualization skills to explain insights to both technical and non-technical audiences.

An eye for detail when monitoring daily results and a passion for tuning and optimizing systems.

Proficiency with data analysis in R or Python.

Proficiency writing simple to complex SQL queries to extract and understand data.

Pluses

Bayesian inference, MCMC, or the Stan modeling language.

Linear programming, mathematical optimization, reinforcement learning.

Statistics, Time series, control theory, queuing theory.

Graduate study in any of the above.

Software development experience, particularly in C++ or C#.

Version control and tools for reproducibility (git, Jupyter and R Markdown, make, custom packages).

Comfortable on a Linux command line.

Proficiency in Spanish, French, German, Portuguese, Italian, or other languages for potential client interaction.

Experience

Entry to mid-level professionals.
Travel requirements

< 10% for domestic/international internal or client meetings.
Relocation Available

Partial.
Visa Sponsorship

Case-by-case basis.

(Menlo Park, CA) Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities  we're just getting started. The Growth Marketing team focuses on growing and engaging Facebooks user base. The team is data driven and results focused. We are seeking a talented analyst who thrives at the intersection of data, product, engineering, and marketing. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical, analytical, and product background  with a hunger to make products grow. This position is full-time, part of the Growth & Analytics team and is located in our Menlo Park office. Responsibilities
Leverage data to understand our products in depth, identify areas of opportunity, and execute projects to drive growth and engagement of Facebook users.
Drive projects focusing on new user growth, mobile usage, and revenue - working closely with design, product, engineering, and data teams.
Work both on core Facebook products like news feed, notifications, and mobile, and offsite marketing channels like SEO, SEM, and email.
Use tools like Hadoop/Hive, Oracle, ETL, R, PHP, Python, Excel, MicroStrategy, and many other internal tools to work efficiently at scale.
Minimum Qualifications
6+ years experience with SQL.
6+ years of quantitative or statistical analysis experience.
6+ years of experience managing a project.
6+ years of experience in marketing, advertising or growth.
Ability to process and analyze data sets, and interpret them to make business decisions.
Communication skills and ability to manage a project or product.
Preferred Qualifications
BS or MS in Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Physics, Statistics or related quantitative field.
Software development experience.
Internet Marketing experience.

Do you love data and reporting? Do you currently work with Sales, Marketing, and Customer Success teams? Were looking for an experienced analyst to join our Business Analytics Team to support the Go To Market (GTM) practice and Vista Portfolio reporting initiatives.

As an analyst on the Business Analytics team, you will work closely with colleagues at Vista Consulting Group (VCG) to provide valuable insights about Portfolio Company performance. You will have the opportunity to work directly with leaders within VCG and at Portfolio Companies to drive company strategy and support engagements with data.

Responsibilities:
Collect, report, and analyze Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success data from Vista Portfolio Companies

Provide ongoing support to Vista Go To Market team for specific engagements and ongoing data initiatives

Support the development of analysis deliverables including benchmarking and performance scorecards for use by Portfolio Company and Vista stakeholders

Onboard and provide ongoing support to Portfolio Companies reporting on Vistas GTM metrics; providing clear definitions and systems-level guidance for reporting

Qualifications/Requirements:
BA / BS degree required, quantitative field of study preferred

2+ years of experience in an analyst role supporting sales, marketing, or a customer success organization at an enterprise software company

Highly proficient in reporting out of Salesforce and/or Marketo

Deep understanding of standard Key Performance Indicators for Marketing, Sales, and/or Customer Success (e.g. Lead Funnel, Sales Pipeline, Sales Productivity, Customer Service Case Backlogs, etc.)

Strong communication and presentation skills with experience presenting analysis outputs to a broader audience outside of ops/analysis functional groups

Overview GENERAL SUMMARY OF POSITION:

Under the general supervision of the department head, or designee, the Data Analyst will conduct data analyses and develop/ produce all related reports. This position will provide information to leadership regarding state of the art data management systems and opportunities to enhance analyses, system integration and related databases.

Responsibilities MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Design and develop data collection instruments, databases and procedure manuals based on thorough knowledge of data files, related databases, and systems integration
Design and implement data management and quality control procedures, including writing technical requirements and documentation of data sets
Participate in project meetings related to data analysis and management
Produce and report data analysis reports. May be required to provide tabular and graphic summaries of analyses in a form suitable for inclusion in manuscripts for publication in peer reviewed scientific journals as well as for presentation at scientific meetings
Conduct in-depth analysis of project data, performing computations with a high degree of independence
Ensure accuracy of reports by data review and resolving discrepancies internally for assigned reports
Provide interpretation of data to senior management
Provide periodic reports to management regarding status of assigned projects and recommend corrective actions when necessary
Schedule, plan, coordinate, and review project activities related to data
Review and monitor compliance with the federal and state regulations
Perform other duties as required

Qualifications REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Bachelors degree in a business, health sciences, or a related field or equivalent
4 years of related experience
Demonstrated experience/skills in appropriate computer, statistical or database applications
Demonstrated ability to research issues and resources; basic record-keeping and organizational skills
Demonstrated ability to write reports, journal articles and/ or other technical documents
Excellent communication, both oral and written
Interpersonal skills necessary to interact successfully with a wide range of individuals
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:
Experience with analytic packages such as SAS, SQL, or SPSS
Strong Data Management skills
Expertise with Microsoft Office products, especially excel
Able to use quantitative skills to develop data summaries and produce data outputs

Job Title: Business Analyst
Location: Atlanta , Georgia
Reports To: Director, Competitive Strategy

Company Summary
Intradiems SaaS product creates real-time frontline workforces that deliver a better customer experience and better business results . Solutions such as intraday task management, intraday sta ffing, reskilling, channel balancing , and real-time a dherence enable businesses to immediately react to changing events and conditions . More than 3 50,000 contact center, field service, retail, bank branch, and back office employees around the wo rld use Intradiem every day. Intradiem is a venture-back ed software start up located in Atlanta, GA. To learn more visit Intradiem.com

Position Overview
We are looking for an outstanding Business Analyst to be part of the Competitive Strategy team and be responsible for executing an offensive competitive strategic plan to ensure Intradiem wins against key competitors . This position serves as a key business advisor to the sales, marketing, development/product management, and operations departments in the translation of competitive insights into concrete business recommendations. The Business Analyst provides research and insight on market conditions and competitive landscape, often in a fast-paced environment. This position is required to bring information synthesized from multiple primary and secondary sources into the business decision making processes and integrates strategic market insights into existing products and services.

Responsibilities
Profile competitor management and products/solutions and assess relative strengths and weaknesses in general and in the context of specific sales cycles. Collect and analyze large amounts of information obtained through both primary and secondary research. Maintain competitive playbooks for agreed upon list of companies seen as mid and long term competitive threats. Creatively identify and recommend offensive tactics to anticipated competitive threats. Create and maintain competitor profiles, market share reports, competitive earnings call reports, and emerging risks . Write and organize business requirements to define alternative solutions for how to access data from key third party software vendors to proactively guard against integration lock out. Create and maintain an in-house competitive intelligence database or repository of information. Create and maintain a list of technical contacts for the top third party software vendors driving the Intradiem provider integrations. Conduct timely, in-depth, ad hoc analyses as requested .

Requirements 2 + years of technical experience with demonstrated success in a B2B SaaS software environment Call Center/Contact Center experience OR strong working knowledge of ACD/WFM systems Strong analytical, written, a nd verbal communication skills Proven ability to understand and translate technical concepts to business stakeholders High-horsepower thinker  High Execution doer Ability to solve problems independently and draw accurate conclusions from data using basic analytic techniques Well organized, self-starter who is able to prioritize, multitask and adhere to deadlines Ability to connect and implement key themes and concepts across seemingly independent projects High level of creativity and curiosity Must be able to thrive in a highly dynamic, flexible work environment and switch rapidly from strategy to execution

Education
BA/BS

Intradiem, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

CGI Federal is seeking a Database Administrator to provide technical and analytical support as part of our project team located in Arlington, VA. Experience with Oracle database technology and Microsoft Server Operating Systems is a must. Understanding the full lifecycle within the development is a plus. This role requires a degree of independent analysis, so self-motivation and the ability to drive and own tasks are preferred. Candidates should be able to communicate effectively and comfortably with all levels of CGI and client management as well as with other contracting staff.

Top candidates for this position will work well in a collaborative environment, and will be eager to learn new technical methods and subject matter. Analysts who are willing to make a long-term commitment to gaining a deep knowledge of Momentum Financials and Momentum Acquisitions are strongly encouraged to apply!

- Lead analyst for an Oracle 12c database upgrade for two Momentum systems

- Software Installation and Maintenance
- Issue Debugging, Analysis, and Resolution
- Integration Server Monitoring and Maintenance
- Modifications to Momentum Software or Custom Interfaces, Extracts, Utilities, and Reports

- Oracle Database technology or related database experience, 2+ years
- Technical Analysis experience, 1+ years
- System support experience, 1+ years
- Strong SQL skills, 2+ years

BROOKLYN, NEW YORK

StrongArm is the worlds leading safety science company, capturing, analyzing and delivering actionable insights that drive worker safety and enterprise value. Utilizing complex smart sensors and machine learning StrongArm can effectively develop, manufacture and deploy the next generation of industrial safety equipment. Ensuring the backbone of our economy - the Industrial Athlete - is Proud, Protected and Productive.

POSITION OVERVIEW:
As Data Scientist, you will play a vital role in leading the data intelligence, analytics strategy, delivering data-driven insights, and ultimately driving product innovation - impacting millions of industrial workers around the world. StrongArms clients span across multiple industries such as 3PL, Distribution Centers, Manufacturing, Industrial Technology, Transportation, etc.

You will be responsible for looking at a tremendous amount of data, developing hypothesis and creating models to generate valuable insights to enhance core product features of the FUSE Risk Management Platform and deliver business intelligence to our clients. You will have the opportunity to set the foundations for the future of data science, analytics, and the infrastructure related to scale this rapidly growing part of the company and product.

You will interface with subject matter experts in the field of safety science, ergonomics, and industrial hygiene, software engineers for implementation, and customer facing team members to help drive new insights to customers. You must be able to thrive in a fast-past design culture, and enjoy holding real responsibilities solving challenging problems.

The ideal candidate for this position must have strong data and business intelligence background. Were looking for someone who is driven and passionate about data, with the ability to communicate and present data models, tests, results, and implications.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Data Modeling / Testing / Implementation:
Interpreting existing and new data sets to discover new insights that feed directly into product, sales, and business opportunities
Cleaning, validating, and ensuring the accuracy, completeness, and uniformity of all data inputs and outputs.
Lead the Data Science & Analytics team, focusing on the design and execution of advanced analytical data exploration, mining, inference, models and systems
Develop and deliver high-impact tools and insights comprised of aggregated data sets and advanced algorithms with a clean user experience both internally and externally
Utilizing advanced analytical methods and complex models, drive the manipulation, refinement, and integration of new and existing data from the FUSE IIoT sensors and the clients injury, claims, and EH&S data
Data Communication and Reporting:
Translate complex data problems, solutions, and implications to various stakeholders of the organization including customers
Provide guidance to and collaborate with the data analytics team to deliver comprehensive and accurate safety insights for the client
Drive the delivery of a clear and robust data narrative and storytelling for all FUSE Platform accounts, showcasing FUSE data value in-depth, accuracy, and pertinence
Serve as the subject matter expert in all things data
Be the data communication lead for internal stakeholders; equip sales, marketing, and client services with intelligence on data-related topics and account-specific data insights
KEY REQUIREMENTS / QUALIFICATIONS:
3+ years of experience in an advanced analytics or consulting role or similar experience in academia
Advanced Degree (Masters or Ph.D.) with a specialization in a STEM major
Experience and demonstrated proficiency in statistical methods (i.e., parametric and non-parametric regression, time-series, panel data analysis, survival analysis, etc.) and machine learning techniques (i.e., methods of supervised and unsupervised learning such as clustering, regression, classification, ensemble methods, etc.)
Deep knowledge and expertise of multiple analytics and programming languages such as R or Python
A strong understanding of the differences between inferential and predictive models and experience applying methods in both areas
At least one or more published academic papers
Experience with data visualization techniques and concepts
Experience in consulting and/or leading projects that encompass direct interaction with internal business clients
PREFERRED SKILLS/ EXPERIENCE:
Experience with computer vision and metadata generation from IIoT devices or wearables
Previous experience with Scala, Java, Spark, Hive and/or Hadoop
Adaptable and flexible to changing business needs
Strong ability to work and problem-solve independently, collaboratively, and creatively
StrongArm Technologies is an equal opportunity employer.

As a Data Scientist, youll solve a wide range of unstructured data (text/NLP, audio, image) problems our customers have by first understanding them, designing and developing technical solutions & implementations, and then reporting results in an engaging manner. The role will involve analyzing complex data, generating insights, and creating classifiers and other solutions as needed. The ideal candidate for this position will possess ability to do both independent & team based research and generate insights from large data sets by asking the right questions in addition to a hands-on-attitude of servicing/managing day-to-day data requests and analysis.

Specific duties include but not limited to:
Understanding business requirements & associated data to best define and implement the strategy to meet those needs using NLP & machine learning
Working with customer SMEs to understand what they want to see & do and then using data to solve for the best strategies on how to accomplish that within constraints
Working with team leads, product and analytical teams to test hypotheses, and answer key questions
Required Education and Experience:
Bachelors in Computer Science, Applied Math, Statistics, or a scientific field with a strong background in natural language processing, language models, text analytics, or text mining.
Programming experience in one or more dynamic languages such as Scala, Python, R, etc.
3+ professional experience with modeling and analysis, building classifiers, computational linguistics/NLP, machine learning, and/or large-scale big data mining
Ability to quickly come up to speed on and contribute to complex code based with minimal supervision
Excellent customer facing skills and an ability to work internally and at customer sites collaborating with colleagues both internal and external and customer SMEs
Working knowledge of relational (e.g. SQL) databases
Preferred Technology Experience:
Experience with Deep Learning, including: Recursive neural networks, Recurrent neural networks, LSTMs, Convolutional neural networks, GANs, Reinforcement learning, tensorflow, torch/pytorch
Working knowledge of Hadoop/YARN
Programming experience in Java
Experience with data visualization tools
Researching and recommending machine learning algorithms and data sets for advancing the state-of-the-art techniques for entity resolution, entity reconciliation, named entity recognition, co-reference, anaphora, etc.
Knowledge of the financial domain.

Heres the gist:
Vettery is a tech company, but what we ultimately do is help people find their dream job. We are looking for self-starters who care about helping people find a job they love! Its pretty simple, we are looking for hungry people with an energy to disrupt an ancient industry, while also enjoying the perks of a growing startup.

Vettery is growing quickly and this role has the potential for huge impact on our trajectory. The focus of the data science team is on digitizing recruiting from candidate sourcing to profile vetting and curation to making the best matches between candidates and companies. Were looking to add a Data Scientist to work on decision support, product optimization, and operation scaling projects across these areas. Youll be reporting directly to our Director of Data Science and working closely with the product and engineering teams. The ideal candidate is a critical thinker and a good communicator who excels in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities:
Build machine learning infrastructure and models (e.g. recommendation engines, statistical models, NLP engines) that drive activity on our platform, scale our business, and enhance the user experience
Collaborate with engineering and product leaders, as well as the co-founders, to frame and tackle a problem, both mathematically and within the business context
Develop creative solutions to our biggest data science and engineering challenges
Communicate rationale for decisions and findings from analyses to facilitate operation decisions
Design and track experiments for data science products as well as analyses throughout the organization
In short, contribute meaningfully on all phases of the data science product lifecycle (exploratory data analysis, model development, model productionizing, rollout, and evaluation)
Requirements:
Ph.D. in Statistics, Operations Research, Mathematics, Computer Science, or other quantitative field
2+ years of industry experience delivering and scaling successful and innovative machine learning products (e.g. recommendation engines, experimentation systems)
Track record of success working both independently and with key stakeholders to identify and solve data science problems
Strong skills in statistical languages (e.g. Python/R) and querying languages (e.g. SQL)
Experience with NLP a plus! (but not required)
With the above said, we always encourage people of all backgrounds and experiences to apply. We understand that job listings don't always allow your unique work history to shine so we invite you to show us what you know!
The laundry list of tech we like:
Python, PHP, Angular, Elasticsearch, AWS, MySQL, Apache. On the Data Science side, we're using Microservices API serving recommendations for our web app (Python, SQLAlchemy, MySQL, Flask).

Benefits:
Competitive salary
Open vacation & sick time
Medical, vision, and dental insurance
Apple laptop computer
Frequent team outings, lunches, and team building events
A beautiful office in Union Square, recently named one of Crains 100 Best Places to Work ( http://www.crainsnewyork.com/article/20160928/SMALLBIZ/160929892/crains-unveils-the-100-best-places-to-work-in-new-york-city-in-2016 ) in New York City
Lots of free food: stocked kitchen + beverages

We seek a Data Scientist with deep expertise working with large datasets to join our growing scientific team. Reporting to the Data Science Lead, you will work with a large, interdisciplinary team and leverage your experience in data analytics to make a meaningful impact on womens health.

Responsibilities

Work with large scale structured and unstructured clinical data.
Develop standardized and automated processing pipelines to prepare data and generate content for analytic activities.
Perform statistical analyses and generate reports summarizing data structure, content and trends.
Design, develop, and maintain predictive models in production environments.
Work cross-functionally with team members from Bioinformatics, Biointerpretation, and Product.
Plan and execute analytic solutions for scientific audits, reviews, and reports with minimal supervision.
Qualifications

PhD in Statistics.

job_title: IT Data Scientist - Grid Analytics Intern
summary:
Learn IBM Spectrum LSF Analytics and the engineering design grid at Qorvo and the Vertica database.
The intern will be exposed to the goals of the engineering grid and develop data science driven insights into optimization of the design workload.
Develop insights for the future grid configuration through understanding the database schema and developing new views of the data either in Tableau or with Python scripting and simple web based reporting.
Incorporate costs into the analysis such that decisions might be made around on premise and cloud based grids.
Document and report on findings.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Currently enrolled in BSCS or Data Science program.
Student must have good working knowledge of Python, excellent ability to work with databases, and a strong desire to fish for data.
Self-Starter with good communication skills.
Must have a 3.0 GPA or higher.
NOTE: Because this is a student internship, candidate must be a currently enrolled student in a degree-seeking accredited program.

Please Note : Because this position is part of a business unit that has contracts with the US government, qualified candidates must have US Worker status. This usually means they are a US citizen or hold a green card. Students on visas such as F-1 or J-1 do not qualify. If you hold one of these visas, we encourage you to apply to any of our other qualifying positions.

At Relay, we believe that data-driven decision-making is essential to helping our institution meet its goals. Researchers at Relay are committed to producing innovative and timely scholarship on how teachers and school leaders, in partnership with their schools and communities, can raise student achievement and help young people develop the character strengths that are needed to be successful in school and life.

Reporting to the Director of Research and Data, the Data Analyst will help to organize data across Relay to help program staff and senior leaders to make decisions. The Data Analyst will help to collect and manage the data as well as produce data visualizations and reports using data. Relay continues to extend its reach nationally and the Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in data reporting from all of Relay's programs and campuses.

As such, the Data Analyst will play a role in supporting teams in accessing data and using data for continuous learning and improvement efforts. This is an outstanding opportunity to make meaningful and foundational contributions to the work of an institution that is reshaping the landscape of urban, public education.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Collaborate on the design, management, and administration of internal data collection systems
Review, clean, and analyze Relay data to generate insight about institutional effectiveness and program quality and success (e.g., student performance, student satisfaction, student retention and persistence)
Perform data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and potentially useful information for instructional faculty and senior staff (e.g., student performance, student satisfaction, student retention and persistence)
Produce various reports accurately and on time
Create and populate key dashboards using institutional data accurately and on time
Prepare visual representations of data and analytical results (e.g., tables, figures, presentation slides)
Communicate research findings to non-technical audiences, in writing, and verbally
Respond to requests for data from senior Relay staff on demand
QUALIFICATIONS

First and foremost, the Data Analyst must share the teams sense of urgency about the need to improve student achievement through phenomenal teacher and instructional leader preparation.

Additionally, candidates for the position must have the following:

BA/BS degree in education, mathematics, economics, public policy or the social sciences required; Masters degree preferred
Experience collecting, analyzing, and reporting data, associated with education
Demonstrated knowledge with various computer information and data management systems (i.e., Microsoft Excel), in addition to general proficiency and problem solving regarding information; experience using Stata preferred
Experience producing data visualizations and reports using complex datasets, especially using the software Tableau
Exceptional project management skills, attention to detail, and ability to multi-task
Excellent writing and communication skills
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with a wide range of constituencies in a diverse community
Ability to work in a highly collaborative team environment while demonstrating the ability to solve problems independently
Ability to set priorities for use of ones time, work under pressure, and adjust tasks appropriately
A demonstrated passion for urban education and closing the opportunity gap
Ability to work efficiently, intensely, and within an entrepreneurial environment
Authorized to work in the United States
COMPENSATION

Relay offers a competitive salary and benefits package for full-time employees.

company_name: Duke University and Duke University Health System
summary:
Occupational Summary
As the Duke School of Medicine moves towards its vision of an integrated home for research combined with world class clinical care in a learning and evidence-based academic environment, the Department of Anesthesiology is positioning itself at the heart of these initiatives through the growth of its IT Solutions Team. The ideal candidate will facilitate, coordinate and monitor the design, implementation and maintenance of research databases for the Duke University Center for Translational Pain Medicine (CTPM) and serve as a liaison among clinical and analytic research users. Work Performed Design, implement and maintain databases for the Duke University Center for Translational Pain Medicine (CTPM) to include patient research data and specimens as well as legacy study materials. Prepare guidelines for use in all data automation efforts and establish common definition for each automated data element provided or used. Assist data users and applications development teams in planning efforts by advising them of data conventions and definitions. Resolve conflicts arising over the creation, control and use of data; develop and enforce data base use guidelines. Prepare interim and final reports on study datasets, including summary statistics of enrollment and other variables. Convert and upload datasets in formats useful for collaboration and public data sharing resources. Establish and maintain an index to all research data and provide information to users regarding location and accessibility of data; monitor requests for and creation of analytical datasets. Monitor database performance and serve as quality control agent for database use. Improve data models and refine ETL processes on a recurring interval. Provide consultation and training sessions to CTPM database users. Serve as a liaison to database vendors to ensure current training, equipment, conventions and updates are maintained. Ensure that external and internal regulations and policies governing data management are met including regulations concerning security, auditability and privacy. Provide initial authorizations to application developers on test data bases. Perform other related duties incidental to the work described herein.

Proficiency with SQL language. Experience with Microsoft SQL Server (preferred), Oracle database systems, or Postures / MySQL databases. Database design for large research datasets. Database ETL experience between large and complex systems. Prefer experience with lab and research software such as statistical programming in SAS and R, or LIMS specimen-tracking software. The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified.
Education

Work generally requires a bachelor's degree in mathematics, computer science, or a computer-related field or the equivalent coursework or technical training.
Experience

Work requires four years of progressive programming or database administration experience to include design, implementation, tuning,backup, recovery, modification and reorganization of mainframe administrative relational databases for a large/complex computer network. OR AN EQUIVALENT COMBINATION OF RELEVANT EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE

Duke University is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer committed to providing employment opportunity without regard to an individuals age, color, disability, genetic information, gender, gender expression, gender identity, national origin, race, religion, sexual orientation, or veteran status. To achieve this exchange, it is essential that all members of the community feel secure and welcome, that the contributions of all individuals are respected, and that all voices are heard. All members of our community have a responsibility to uphold these values. Essential Physical Job Functions: Certain jobs at Duke University and Duke University Health System may include essential job functions that require specific physical and/or mental abilities. Additional information and provision for requests for reasonable accommodation will be provided by each hiring department.
