Description
This position is a multifaceted role with a variety of tasks and responsibilities that responds to and resolves complex customer issues escalated from the AppleCare organization, other members of the AMP Ops teams or Apple executives. Additionally, the role actively participates in new product launches (readiness) by teaming with other iTunes groups as well as AppleCare Engineering to ensure positive customer experiences with the new product or service right from launch. The position uses a variety of systems and tools to help resolve issues with the iTunes store that impact one or many customers.

This role will also be asked to participate in reporting and analysis to provide summary and detailed information for other parts of the iTunes business regarding how are customers are using our products and services. Strong analytical and reporting skills are needed coupled with an ability to lead meetings.

Responsibilities:
Represent Customer Experience team and work closely with other AMP Ops and business teams to build strong relationships aimed at ensuring positive customer experiences with our products/services.
Work cross functionally during product launches to understand impacts on our existing base and advocate for our customers during the design, development and implementation stages to ensure an exceptional and seamless customer experience.
Identify issues and trends impacting customers proactively and resolve or escalate appropriately.
Work closely with internal engineering teams to ensure support tools provide needed information, features and flows to advisors after launch of new services/products.
Manage all production work including but not limited to customer outreach and appeasement via email.
Participate in issue investigation/resolution/escalation when new problems arise from existing products/services. Should represent the iTunes business and advocate for the customer when working to resolve these types of problems.
Analyze trending customer data and build reporting that highlights key issues, their scope and recommendations for resolution.
Education
Bachelors Degree in communication, technology or other related field required

CREATION OF TABLES, LISTINGS, GRAPHS, NARRATIVE, ETC.

Participate in the development of new processes and provide accurate and timely responses to routine requests from clients and guide clients on possible options for deliverables for non-routine requests.
Communicate an understanding of statistical programming concepts, basic clinical principles and act in accordance with those principles. Effectively mentor non-statistical programming peers with regard to statistical programming practices and mentor statistical programming/non-statistical programming peers with regard to functional operations.
Coordinate the statistical programming activities for 0-3 clinical projects within the same therapeutic area. Oversee the work of 0-3 Statistical Programmers/Senior Statistical Programmers or contractors.

Demonstrated satisfactory ability to interpret statistical analysis plans to develop analysis data set specifications.
Expertise in the use of UNIX utilities and SAS Macros.
Ability to work collaboratively with others to develop quality CRFs, databases, reports, publications and regulatory submission.
Ability to appropriately delegate assignments and review deliverables so that projects are delivered on time with suitable quality.
Ability to identify opportunities for productivity improvements and formulate implementation plans.
Ability to contribute to the determination of project standards related to output design and statistical programming conventions, and, with supervision ensures they are appropriate to support project objectives.

About ZapLabs LLC
ZapLabs ( www.zaplabs.com ) is the innovation and technology hub for global real estate leader Realogy Holdings Corp. (NYSE: RLGY), and the driving force behind inventive technology for brokers and agents affiliated with Realogys world renowned real estate brands. ZapLabs delivers its highly effective consumer, sales associate and broker solutions in support of Realogys leading franchise brands and is positioned to expand the scope of its technology development efforts to encompass Realogys other business segments, including residential brokerage, relocation and settlement services. ZapLabs is headquartered in Emeryville, California.

Job Title : Junior Data Scientist

At ZapLabs, we work to build and improve a platform that helps real estate professionals work effectively, and helps delight home buyers and sellers with an excellent experience. We do that by combining great technology with great people  and were looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team.

What were looking for :
Youre a talented, creative, and motivated data scientist who loves data  and youre ready to work with a team of individuals who share the same passion. Youve got a related degree under your belt, and maybe even some experience, and youre excited about taking your programming and database knowledge to the next level. You enjoy challenging projects involving large data pipelines, cleaning and transforming data, and algorithm development. With your strong analytical skills, your unwavering commitment to quality, your excellent technical skills, and your collaborative work ethic, youll do great things here at ZapLabs.

What youll do :
As a Junior Data Scientist, youll be responsible for mastering our data and designing the systems which enable us to use it most effectively. You will be designing and implementing processes around machine learning, business intelligence, and predictive analytics that meet the needs of millions of agents, brokers, home buyers, and sellers. Youll work with a variety of teams and individuals to understand their data needs and design innovative solutions. Your role will involve working with a team of talented engineers and collaborating with product managers and designers to investigate new data sources, perform data modeling, and deploy new features.

Skills, accomplishments, & interests you should have :
BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or related technical discipline or equivalent combination of training and experience
Experience with data modeling projects and algorithms
Knowledge of data management best practices
Solid knowledge of at least one of the following: Python, Scala, R, Java
Good working knowledge of the Linux CLI
Confidence working with SQL
Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Nice to haves :
Familiarity with Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Cassandra, HDFS, etc.) is a big plus!
Experience with Java, Scala, Spark Streaming, Spark MLlib
Machine learning, collaborative filtering, NLP, or related projects
Graduate degree or published research in a related field
Current experience with Amazon EMR, EC2, S3
Ability to work quickly with an eye towards the big picture

Job Description
We are looking for a SQL Data Analyst (and data guru) to join our SoCal Analytics crew. In this role, you will support numerous data initiatives and projects that revolve around analytics and business intelligence. You'll serve as a subject-matter expert on a large number of data repositories and data sources. You'll perform data mining/exploration and data manipulation, provide data pulls based on business requirements, and automate ETL jobs to help support our analytics eco-system. In addition, you'll help recommend solutions to address data needs and problems.

What you can expect to do in your new gig
Lots and lots of SQL querying. (We've got a ton of data.)
Automate reports and ETL processes through SSRS and SSIS; Creation and improvement of Stored Procedures
Investigate data issues and anomalies
Gather, write, review and Improve business requirements
Skills & Requirements
Your qualifications include:
6+ years in a senior SQL role with direct responsibility for helping to answer business questions and challenges through data; You know how to turn data into meaningful output that end users can easily understand and digest
You have that special ability to bridge the communication gap between the technical teams and the business teams; You understand what the business wants/needs and you're successful at getting those needs translated to a technical level
You are great at trouble-shooting data issues
You are very methodical and logical in your approach to things; You understand the need to QA and triple-check everything you do because accuracy is key to your success as a Data Analyst
You know how to look at data objectively; It's easy to manipulate data in order to support a particular notion, but you want to do the right thing and let the data tell its own story
We also like to see:
The ability to digest a lot of information and be able to figure out how/if they impact any of your current work or processes; Change is a constant at Nexon!!
Solid foundation in analytics
You work well in a team culture that straddles the divide between introversion while at our desks and extroversion when engaging with other teams who need our support
You work well with a manager who will drill down into the details of your work when needed but will also expect a high level of autonomy and proactivity from you
How to Apply

Resume
Cover letters are optional, but encouraged

Job Description

As a member of the Ecosystem Data Security team, the incumbent is responsible for working as a team member in the execution for the Third Party Risk agent registration program for North America. The program is specifically aimed at promoting the safety and soundness of the payment system by ensuring that third party agents are registered, PCI DSS validated, and meet Visa rules.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES
Agent Registration Program Mailbox: Manage group mailbox and respond to general registration and program inquiries within stipulated timeframes.

Agent Registration Program:
Manage agent registration tool cases. Send Welcome Kit to new third party agents

Agent Registration Tool: Own and lead agent registration tool and enhancements.

Operational Alignment : Ensure execution against the Third Party Risk Program requirements (i.e. policies, procedures, controls). Identify opportunities for program improvement.

Drive Registrations: Uncover unregistered agents and drive agent registrations to increase transparency of third party participants.
KEY PERFORMANCE INDICATORS
Ensure that outliers and exception cases are managed effectively. Work collaboratively with stakeholders to correct operational and other deficiencies in a timely manner.
Collaborate with global team and IT to ensure agent registration tool enhancements are documented as business requirements and completed within timeframe and budget.
Report regularly to management regarding third party registration metrics.
Report number of new third parties identified and registered.
Achieve good audit results.
Collaborate with team to ensure the Visa Global Registry of Service Providers information is accurate and current. Qualifications

Professional

Preferred Education: Bachelors Degree

Minimum 3 years related professional work experience

Ability to manage assignments that are of diverse scope and complexity and require significant initiative and judgment.

Technical
Understanding of risk management required
Advanced proficiency on PowerPoint, Excel, and Word.
Knowledge of SAS, SQL a plus
Knowledge of mathematical and statistical techniques for analysis a plus
Must be well organized and rigorous in prioritization of tasks and projects
Business

Good interpersonal skills and the ability to work as part of a diverse team and build cooperative, productive relationships with internal and external stakeholders
Strategic thinker with good problem solving skills
Familiarity with the payment landscape is a plus
Ability to work independently and efficiently in a team environment
Proven ability to work independently and anticipate deliverables needed with a drive to deliver results

Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Our mission at Socrata is to help government use data more strategically and effectively in the design and delivery of their programs and missions. Since 2007, we have focused on improving the access and utility of data held by government institutions around the world, and making that data useful to people outside and inside of government.
Socrata set out to develop a new kind of cloud-based software infrastructure and an innovation network designed to unlock the flow of government data. Were the leader of a global movement called open data where engaged citizens, civic hackers, elected leaders, program managers, entrepreneurs, journalists, scientists and researchers are applying data to age-old problems to make government more efficient and to improve society as a whole by improving government outcomes.
Our data platform and cloud-based solutions support the worlds most ambitious open data programs and internal data sharing programs at every level of government. Our customers include the US Federal Government; half of US states and most major US cities and counties. Some of our amazing customers include states like New York, Texas and Utah; cities like Seattle, Chicago, Los Angeles and New York; federal agencies like the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC), US Department of Commerce, the US Department of Transportation and the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services! Our select few non-governmental customers are ones with influence over government data policy, including the World Bank, the United Nations and the European Commission.
How We Act
At Socrata, how we act with each other and our customers embodies the core values and our code of conduct: We value big ideas and creative execution We build open and honest relationships We are results driven and accountable We celebrate success together We aspire to be remarkable
Do you share our values? Is this the kind of environment where youll feel empowered to do your best and most meaningful work?
Why Us?
Do you have a passion for solving problems using data, data analysis, and data visualizations? Are you interested in helping the worlds most influential organizations to be more transparent and have a bigger impact? Want to join a rapidly growing company, a fun and supportive work environment, and a great group of smart people?
If so, read on
We are seeking a Data Analyst t o join our Customer Success team. Analysts on our Customer Success team act as technical consultants for the worlds leading governments and NGOs; designing and building data-driven experiences and leveraging data science best practices to help our customers make better decisions, provide better services to their constituents, and provide a basis for stronger economic growth. This position is location agnostic. You may work from either our Washington DC or Seattle, WA offices, or from a distribute home office anywhere in the U.S. where you can easily get to an airport.
The ideal candidate will have the following attributes You want to help customers leverage data in ways that encourage transparency and drive better, more efficient governance. You have enthusiasm for and comfort with working directly with government and other public sector organizations, and have the ability to: Architect solutions, including data publishing pipelines and ETL processes, and data visualizations that help customers understand and solve their business problems Understand customer goals and work creatively to accomplish those goals with product- and process-driven solutions Work to customer design specifications, and to work creatively without them when necessary Emphasize long-term customer success over temporary solutions but know when to make trade-offs Contribute to innovation and changes to the implementation methodology and best practices in support of advanced customer uses of the Socrata platform. You love helping customers in a consultative role, and have the ability to: Proficiently translate those needs into the right technology Proficiently translate technical needs to a non-technical audience Estimate consulting levels of effort required for supporting technical data work for customer implementations Develop a deep understanding of the business and end user needs Effectively understand and analyze both technical and business risks and impact Communicate those risks to the business owners, so they can make informed decisions You have significant data analysis experience, including programmatic and/or statistical approaches. We are currently using primarily Python and R, though familiarity with other tools is welcome. Experience working with APIs preferred. You have the ability to: Write clean, maintainable code; including documentation that demonstrates best practices in data management and data analysis Influence and drive software development best practices through the team You want to work in company where everybody believes in a shared mission and has a strong sense of shared responsibility. You have the ability to: Proactively identify areas of improvement in collaboration with team on solutions, methodology, best practices, and thought leadership around the Socrata platform solutions. A bachelors degree is required, preferably in a technical field

We especially want to hear from you if: You are comfortable making technical decisions when there is no clear correct answer You have a proven track record of shipping great products or solutions You are not afraid to hold yourself accountable and learn from mistakes
Attributes that are helpful, but not required Experience with data visualization research and/or design, analytical or DBA best practices Familiarity with open data standards and metadata guidelines and/or schemas Familiarity with concepts related to the semantic web  open linked data, RDF, OWL, SPARQL, etc.

Must be willing to travel to work directly with customers onsite. We estimate the amount of travel to be 70%.

About Socrata
Socrata has 160 employees and is headquartered in a vibrant and creative workspace in Seattle, WA. The company also has regional offices in Washington, DC and London, UK. Socrata has raised $55M in venture backing from top VC firms including Sapphire Ventures, OpenView Venture Partners, Frazier Technology Ventures, and Delta-v Capital. You can learn more about Socrata at www.socrata.com .
Competitive salary including stock options and great benefits are offered. Qualified applicants may apply right here and also contact Socrata at peopleops@socrata.com .
Socrata is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at Socrata are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. Socrata will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. Socrata encourages applicants of all ages.

job_title: Business Strategy Analyst, iTunes / Apple Music
summary:
Apple is seeking a candidate with a strong aptitude for business analysis to join the Apple Music Global Business Team. Work closely with internal and external/industry stakeholders to understand analytics needs, independently solve problems and communicate complex analyses with ease. As part of a centralized team that collaborates with label relations, marketing, editorial, and data teams, act as a domain expert for how data can inform and drive Apple Music business strategy across the iTunes and Apple Music business landscape. Act as a conduit between industry stakeholders and internal teams, helping to educate the industry on our outward-facing BI tools, and evangelizing best practices.
Key Qualifications
Preference 3 - 5 years working in Music or related entertainment content industry
Preference 3 - 5 years of experience working with large datasets to deliver business insights and recommendations
Knowledge of statistical principles a plus
Familiarity with subscription and download business models
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, comfortable working cross-functionally across a large organization
Strong analytical skills, strong out-of-the-box thinking and a curious mind
Aptitude for project managing and driving deliverables
Comfortable working with and helping to define data visualization tools
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, including the ability to convey complex findings in a clear, concise and credible manner
Strong ability to present data in a compelling way

Description
Help grow an emerging product with an aggressive trajectory in the competitive streaming music landscape, while seeking opportunities to maximize revenue in a mature download business. Leverage music analytics domain expertise for internal/external stakeholders, guiding decisions on business strategy, customer experience, and strategic opportunities. Seeking someone who loves building narratives backed by data and demonstrate a strong desire to continually improve user engagement and retention.

Education
Bachelors degree, preferably in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, or relevant field.

Overview
Insight Education Group is an international educational consulting company that works with education leaders to develop the strategy and confidence to lead bold changeand provides the boots on the ground to make it happen.
As former teachers, coaches, school leaders and high-level district and state administrators, we appreciate the challenges, nuances, and opportunities of implementing large-scale change and we know the keys to making them stick.
Since 2000, we have supported schools, districts, charter management organizations and states through some of their largest challenges, including:
successfully turning around chronically under-performing schools,
training aspiring and current leaders to be strategic and get the right things done, and
helping to change the culture of teacher growth to one of trust.
Learn more information about our company.
Position
Analysts play an essential role in supporting our client work.
They work with other members of the Service Delivery team to produce client-facing documents, resources and tools and serve as point for the overall administrative and operational support across a portfolio of contracts.
Analysts are also responsible for collecting and analyzing various data sources and writing reports that synthesize these data.
Additionally, Analysts provide support across other company-wide efforts including project coordination and research for business development.
This position requires some travel.
Duties and Responsibilities
Word Processing
Support Partnership Managers and other project team members in designing and developing content for work products including training content and client collateral
Draft, refine and finalize client ready work products including PowerPoint presentations, frameworks, rubrics, guidebooks, reports, templates, and tools
Support the creation of planning documents including implementation plans
Draft, refine and finalize internal company documents such as proposals, RFPs, white papers, etc.
Research and Data Analysis
Bring to bear experience and knowledge about education reform, relevant research findings, federal and state policies and effective practices in key education reform areas
Collect and manage data sets from various sources
Conduct basic statistical analyses of various data sources
Design and administer surveys to various constituents and analyze results
Research, gather, organize, and synthesize information sources to inform work products including literature reviews
Project Coordination
Support client engagements through developing meeting agendas, note-taking and synthesizing essential information that outlines follow-up items and next steps
Coordinate the development, completion and submission of proposals and RFPs
Serve as gatekeeper and manager of Service Delivery content and resources
Support overall success of the Service Delivery team through other operational and administrative duties as assigned
Qualifications and Experience
Insight Education Group is a good fit for professionals who have a strong entrepreneurial spiritwho are highly self-motivated, resourceful, are independent self-starters and are comfortable working in a small, nimble organization.
The ideal candidate will also demonstrate exceptional professional behavior, is driven by a passion for high quality education, values collaboration and teamwork, and sees the advantage that diversity brings to providing insightful solutions for our clients.
We are seeking candidates whose own values and approach to work align with our company core values:
Strong commitment to improving learning and achievement for all students, to moving education beyond the status quo
Commitment to company success
Commitment to individual success
Embrace challenges of a dynamic and unpredictable environment
Thrive in a fun and supportive environment
Additionally, the ideal candidate will also demonstrate the following core competencies for this position:
Strong attention to detail
Highly organized and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced environment
Ability to think critically and distill high volumes of information
Strong written and oral communication skills
Minimum Qualifications
Experience teaching in a K-12 setting and/or in a K-12 education environment strongly preferred
Two to four years of experience supporting projects or teams
Proficiency in software and technology that support our work including Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and statistical software (STATA, SPSS, etc.)
Bachelors degree required
Location
This position may be based in:
Austin, Texas
East Coast (US)
Compensation
Insight Education Group provides competitive compensation and an attractive benefits package including a performance-based bonus based on individual and firm success, health care coverage, and access to 401(k) accounts.
To Apply
Applications should include a letter of interest and current resume or curriculum vitae and should be submitted to the form on the right (or below on mobile devices).
Insight Education Group is committed to providing equal opportunities.

Job Description

Incumbent will provide credit risk modeling and analysis support to the loss forecasting team. Incumbent will work with more experienced analysts to moderately complex models and methodologies, and research best practices and new technologies. This work encompasses data mining, statistical analysis, forecasting, and predictive analytics.

Responsibilities include:

 Develops statistical models in support of the firms credit risk management, loss forecasting, capital management, or other key activities.

 Maintains, and monitors statistical models. Monitoring may include calibration, sensitivity analyses, and scenario testing.

 Coding, back testing and implementing models in internal and vended systems may be required.

 Participating in the research, design and implementation of new financial products may be required.

 Other responsibilities include developing and documenting the development process and the testing of the theoretical model frameworks.

Minimum Qualifications:

 Masters degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Finance, Economics, Statistics, or Engineering or equivalent combination of degree and experience.

 Demonstrated technical proficiency related to the position, including one or more of the following: Probability and Statistics; Finance (time value of money, yield curve); Financial engineering (stochastic processes); Programming skills (Visual Basic, C++, and/or Java).

 Proficient utilizing SAS/SQL.

 Analytic programming and forecasting experience desired.

 Proven ability to perform and deliver under very demanding situations. Attention to detail and a sense of ownership for deliverables.

 Strong verbal and written communication skills.

job_title: Data Scientist, Business Intelligence & Data Science
summary:
Starz is currently seeking a Data Scientist to join the Insights and Analytics department. S/he will build predictive models using high volume of data and partner with our analytics teams. The Data Scientist will work closely with cross functional groups to enhance analytical capabilities, identify new growth opportunities, and develop robust analytical capabilities.

The candidate will be responsible for building the predictive platform to forecast demand, understand customer preferences, simulate business outcomes, and optimize major investments.

Responsibilities

Perform machine learning, natural language, and statistical analysis to support analytics

Answer complex business questions by using appropriate statistical techniques on available data or designing and running experiments to gather data

Develop novel applications of classification, forecasting, simulation, optimization, and summarization techniques

Develop robust set of customer signals and propensity models (e.g., look-alike modeling for prospecting, predicting lifetime value, churn propensity drivers)

Drive requirements for 3rd party data acquisition, customer data platform expansion, and customer data platform

Required Skills

1+ years working in a large analytical data ecosystem

Experience in deriving customer behavioral insights from data. Experience in video and entertainment industry a plus

S. or Ph.D. (preferred) in relevant technical field such as Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering, Physics, or Economics

Expert knowledge of analytical tools such as SAS, R or MATLAB and scripting languages such as Python, Perl, or PHP

Background extracting and transforming complex data sets (ETL process design and administration)

Familiarity with relational databases and SQL

Ability to communicate complex quantitative analyses in a clear, precise, and actionable manner

STARZ ( www.starz.com ), a Lionsgate company (NYSE: LGF.A, LGF.B), is a leading global media and entertainment company that provides premium subscription video programming on domestic U.S. pay television networks and produces and distributes content for worldwide audiences, including its investment in the STARZ PLAY Arabia OTT service.

STARZ is the ultimate destination for obsessable TV, movies and more. Characters who pull you in and stories that stay with you. From bold Original Series to the best movies, whatever you love, STARZ ignites your passions.

STARZ offers a competitive compensation package and an attractive benefits program to all eligible employees including a variety of healthcare plans, dental and vision insurance, 401k, life/disability insurance. Eligible employees will enjoy paid time off in the form of vacation and company holidays.

STARZ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. This means that all applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of gender, age, race, national origin, disability, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, STARZ will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

Required Experience

POSITION SUMMARY
This data analyst position is responsible for performing simple to complex analysis of healthcare data from various sources (Epic and non Epic) both within and external to the organization. The data analyst will support day to day analytical and reporting needs of projects as well as strategic imperatives.
The data analyst will be responsible for data consolidation, turning the data into knowledge by making the data meaningful as well as presentation of information to various leaders and members within the organization.
The data analyst supports all quality based initiatives within the organization by defining performance and outcome metrics, creation and redesign of processes and data validation. Additionally the position is responsible for opportunity identification to support improved clinical and operational outcomes.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Access and analyze data from various databases to support quality and performance improvement initiatives (regulatory and non regulatory).
Consolidate data from multiple sources using industry based tools or manually to be able to process data effectively using various statistical packages such as SQL, Excel (pivots, vlookups, regression, advanced formulas), Minitab, SPSS, SAS and others.
Determine gaps in the information, missing information and ability to go back and re-run data for comprehensiveness and completeness for gap closure.
Turn the data into meaningful knowledge by performing trend analysis, variation analysis and other statistical analysis. Additionally deep dive into case reviews to perform detailed RCA (Root cause analysis).
Create standard and non standard reporting for projects and leaders based on data.
Present data to project leaders, Sr. leaders in a concise manner to be able to drive the direction of the project based on a technical data approach. Clearly document and present risks and assumptions about the data along with data definition.
Meet with various project leaders, Sr. Leaders and other members in the organization to perform a needs assessment to better understand what data is needed for the success of the initiative. Advise project teams about data needs to provide visibility into what data is available and what data can be obtained/collected. Collaborate with Data administrators to close any gaps in data.
Write reports both from a standard front end (Epic reporting workbench) and or non-standard/ad hoc (Business Objects) or other software
Create and monitor KPI's (key performance indicators) for projects.
Create standard practices, processes with peers to structure analytics.
Support existing applications within the organization from a data entry, management and export perspective.
Participates as an active member on various initiatives within the organization by providing data and analytics support.
Creates internal databases for streamlining data processes, data capture and consolidation as needed.
REQUIRED KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS
Experience working with relational databases utilizing SQL
Experience with Crystal Reports, Excel, MS Access, Minitab, SPSS, Business Objects and others as necessary
Ability to use and access data via EMR and other internal software/systems
Able to write simple queries to extract and manipulate data to achieve desired results using select statements, sub-queries, functions, links of multiple tables, etc.
Strong analytical and data management skills and able to handle analytics at all cycles of the project including inception to completion and control to perform extensive root cause analysis
Demonstrated knowledge of ICD-9/10 codes, DRG's and other healthcare classification
Knowledge of quality indicators, process and performance improvement methodologies
Perform trend, regression analysis and display of data using graphical techniques such as scatter plots, histograms, bar charts, trend lines, etc.
Ability to handle confidential information (including PHI) and interact professionally with internal and external clients and vendors
Ability to manage competing deadlines, manage variances in schedules and resources
Exceptional verbal, written and presentation skills
Ability to prioritize, multi-task effectively with minimal supervision
Excellent oral, written and verbal communication skills
EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE/LICENSURE
Education: Bachelor's degree required, preferably in healthcare or statistics related field.
Experience: A minimum of two (2) to three (3) years working experience in the related field.
Certification/Licensure: Certified Professional of Healthcare Quality (CPHQ) or Certified Health Data analyst (CHDA) preferred
Software/Hardware: Crystal Reports, MS products including Excel, MS Access, Minitab, SPSS, SAS, Business Objects and others preferred.

Job Description ***Active TS/SCI with Polygraph Required***

Red Arch Solutions is a proven and effective small business integrator and consultant, recognized as a leading provider of IT development to the Federal Government, and primarily focused within the Intelligence Community.

We are an official Amazon Web Services (AWS) Partner, and are pleased to now offer Cloud Solutions Architecture and Engineering using AWS. We promote the advancement of our staff in achieving AWS certifications.

Red Arch is seeking a Data Analyst to support NGA.

The scope of this effort relates to NGAs Intent-to-Publish (NIP) database providing data stewardship, data identification, data transfer, data dissemination, ensuring the posting of GEOINT products.

Responsibilities/Job Function:
Assist the Program Management Working Group (PMWG) analyze and interpret Foundation GEOINT (FG) product metrics to help NGA understand and improve our customers experience

Leverage a range of data sources (e.g., Web downloads, current NGA Foundation GEOINT/mapping customer requirements, requests for information, production databases, etc.) for an understanding of customer expectations

Provide customer usage metrics on NGAs Intent-to-Publish (NIP) database line items to be used to inform NGA strategy and decisions, customer interactions, featured content, and future GEOINT products and services

Prepare Senior Leadership metrics, pie charts, bar graphs, and creating interactive Pie Charts and Bar Graphs using Tableau software

Filter and clean data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems to share with the developers

Minimum Qualifications
Mandatory Security Clearance Requirement: TS/SCI with CI Poly

Demonstrated experience in providing statistics as applied within MS Office: Excel Pivot Charts; and Oracle SQL

Demonstrated experience in collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy

Effective communications/explaining databases and content to management

Demonstrated experience in writing business queries and ad hoc reports

Demonstrated experience creating presentations using PowerPoint slides

Demonstrated experience with dashboard visualization tools, such as Tableau, to create interactive pie charts and bar graphs

Demonstrated experience in data mining

Ability to develop and manipulate, and maintain databases

Demonstrated experience in COTS statistical software (SPSS, SAS, MatLab etc.), COTS desktop software (MS Office and MS Access), and the Windows operating environment

Demonstrated experience with software packages used for advanced statistical analysis of operational data and tools for data visualization, such as Apache Spark, ElasticSearch, R, Python, and Kibana

A Bachelors Degree from an accredited institute in an area applicable to this position (e.g. information systems, computer science, math, or engineering) and four (4) years of relevant technical experience

An additional four (4) years of relevant technical experience may be substituted for the Bachelors Degree
Must presently be 8570 compliant (IAT Level 2 preferred); must be 8570 compliant (IAT Level 2) by date of security indoctrination with any necessary continuing education (CE) for certification

The Data Scientist is selected by and report to the Director of Data Analytics at Medicaid/CHIP Division. The Data Scientist perform highly advanced (senior level) research and data analytic activities with minimal direction and extensive latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. The Data Scientist will train, lead, assign and/or help to prioritize the work of the other Data Analyst. The Data Scientist design and implement analytical studies; assess validity of statistical methods for appropriate application; plan and/or conduct highly advanced data analytics on Medicaid/CHIP programs and contracts such as Medicaid/CHIP Managed Care and Medicaid fee-for-service; and apply advanced statistical and/or spatial data analyses techniques to Medicaid/CHIP data. The Data Scientist provide consultation and assistance to Medicaid/CHIP staff to develop methods and strategies for more effective contract monitoring, including identification of anomalies relating to service utilization, providers, payment methodologies, and compliance with Medicaid/CHIP contract requirements, reporting of data and analyses. Writes advanced scripts and code for computer based statistics applications. The Data Scientist prepare and reviews a variety of reports, studies, and other deliverables containing analyses of Medicaid/CHIP data, methods, procedures, and relevant sources to enhance Medicaid/CHIP contract management and detect data trends. The Data Scientist performs other duties necessary to achieve the mission of the Medicaid/CHIP Division and the Health and Human Services Commission.

Essential Job Functions:
EJF 1. Prepares and reviews a variety of written, oral, and graphical deliverables containing analyses of Medicaid/CHIP data, methods, procedures, and relevant sources to the Medicaid/CHIP administration and policy analyst to provide data analytics, data trends, and improve the Division's contract management. Time Spent: 25% EJF 2. Designs, reviews and implements analytical studies; assesses validity of statistical methods for appropriate application; plans and/or conducts highly advanced data analytics on Medicaid/CHIP programs and contracts such as Medicaid/CHIP Managed Care and Medicaid fee-for-service; and applies advanced statistical and/or spatial data analyses techniques to Medicaid/CHIP data. The Data Scientist also provides consultation and assistance to Medicaid/CHIP staff to develop methods and strategies for more effective contract monitoring, including identification of anomalies relating to service utilization, providers, payment methodologies, and compliance with Medicaid/CHIP contract requirements, reporting of data and analyses. Writes and reviews advanced scripts and code for computer based statistics applications. Time Spent: 25% EJF 3. Prepares and reviews a variety of reports, studies, and other deliverables containing analyses of Medicaid/CHIP data, methods, procedures, and relevant sources to enhance Medicaid/CHIP contract management and detects data trends. Time Spent: 25% EJF 4. The Data Scientist provides training and assigns and/or prioritizes the work of the Data Analyst Vs. Time Spent: 20% EJF 4. Performs other duties necessary to achieve the mission of the Medicaid/CHIP Division and the Health and Human Services Commission. Time Spent: 5%

DNAnexus is an industry-leading cloud genomics and bioinformatics platform used by pharmaceutical, clinical diagnostic and academic organizations. DNAnexus provides a global network for advanced analysis, collaboration and management of genomic data. The DNAnexus cloud-based platform accelerates science by addressing the challenges of security, scalability, and collaboration required to pursue genomic-based approaches to health, in the clinic and in the research lab. We are a team of experts in computational biology and cloud computing who work with organizations to tackle some of the most exciting opportunities in human health, making it easierand, in many cases, feasibleto work with genomic data. With DNAnexus, organizations can stay a step ahead in leveraging genomics to achieve their goals.

---------------
Job Description
---------------

We are building a sophisticated team that are passionate about using data to help drive informed business and product decisions for DNAnexus. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for using big data tools and techniques to build the data foundation to support business and product decisions. You will work closely with Data Analysts, Product Managers, and Engineering to define and build the data pipelines and platform used to gain a deeper understanding of the business and drive strategies for success. As a Data Engineer, you will collaborate with Data Analysts working with Product, Finance, Marketing, Sales and Science to define the required data models and metrics. The ideal candidate will have a experience working with operational data from cloud businesses and using big data technologies to provide a data layer that can be queried and visualized in dashboards and reports. We are looking for people that are self-starters, focused on results, and have a demonstrated track record of success in fast-paced, cloud companies.

----------------
Responsibilities
----------------

Apply your expertise in data and software engineering to support quantitative analysis and presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand the system. In particular, gain a better understanding of our global multi-region, multi-cloud platform.
Work with the Data Analysts and Product Platform Engineering team to understand the requirements and how they map to the all the available data sources including the DNAnexus platform.
Translate data requirements into well-designed, efficient data models and schemas that empower operational and exploratory analyses
Work with Product Platform Engineering and other data source owners to design and develop data extraction pipelines
Design, develop and launch production pipelines that load and transform the data into a form for the data analysts.
Design and develop key data sets on a data platform that is continuously refreshed to support up-to-date analyses.
Design and develop automated quality control steps that ensure reliable data sets
Support ad-hoc requests from data stakeholders to triage data issues and investigate data questions.
--------------
Qualifications
--------------

4+ years of experience in the data warehousing or analytics space
Strong experience in designing, building, and maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines
Strong experience with schema design and multi-dimensional data modeling
Fluent using SQL on databases and data warehouses
Fluent in programming and analysis using Python, R, Java, Scala
Experience with streaming and queryable big data technologies
Proficient with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Looker
Proficient with tools such as Jupyter notebooks, RStudio
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with ability to communicate data driven insights at both the technical and financial levels.
BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field. MS or PhD a strong plus.
Based in Mountain View, California, DNAnexus is rapidly growing and searching for the best talent to join and enhance our team.

If you are interested in joining our team, please apply today!

This is not a Lab Position.
Up to 50% travel may be required depending on the project.

The Schedule Data Analyst reports directly to the Manager, Service Analysis and Director, Service Planning and will also work directly with the scheduling and service planning areas of the Planning department. This position assist in the development and analysis of Fixed Route, Rapid, Rail and University of Texas shuttle schedules for Capital Metro transit services using manual and automated scheduling techniques. Perform analytical service planning, development tasks, and work on projects. Develop macros, modules and/or queries as directed in support of the data analysis and scheduling functions. This role also develops and maintains critical spreadsheets and data sets.

Primary Responsibilities
 Responsible for obtaining all data needed for future service changes, including data from service planners, route simulations, service providers, BPS , IT Transit Systems and all information on special events.
 Perform complex statistical and trend analyses. Isolates, determines, and reports operational and performance problems and concerns based upon these analyses; recommends changes as appropriate.
 Responsible for conducting Schedule Analysis of running times; passenger loads; and headway requirements. This data is used to build accurate and efficient schedules and to design cost effective routes.
 Develop macros and modules as needed.
 Monitor and track Automatic Passenger Counter ( APC ) assignments, schedules, maintenance and repairs. Report anomalies and trends.
 Create, automate and generate database and management reports from Intelligent Transportation System ( ITS ), Trapeze, UTA and other departmental and agency-wide databases.
 Analyze data for accuracy and integrity. Determine where inaccuracies or exceptions require rejection and/or re-collection of data, and reschedule collections as needed.
 Assist in researching and resolving erroneous data errors between the scheduling software and the ITS software.
 Assist in analyzing monthly OTP reports to redirect scheduling efforts to increase OTP performance on routes that have the largest impact on service.
 Assist in compiling data and generating custom reports required for each schedule change including data files used in printed and online schedules.
 Perform data extraction and run scripts as needed.
 Provide critical information to support regular evaluation of Capital Metro services, including data collection, data retrieval, data analysis, and preparation of reports.
 Provide administrative and technical support to the Strategic Planning department.
 Review data collection/input procedures, identify validity (exceptions and discrepancies) issues, and recommend solutions to ensure integrity of data. Confer with persons originating, handling, entering, or receiving data to identify problems and resolve issues and/or errors prior to advancing information to various departments.
 Responsible for coordinating with BPS , Safety and service providers to insure the most accurate and up to date information is used to produce reports.
 Assist in the data collection required in route schedule development. This includes outside field work, riding buses, various work hours and days as needed.
 Responsible for producing special data files required for various interfaces and outputs used in the production of printed and electronic schedule information.
 Respond to requests for relevant planning or service analysis data as needed for internal and external customers, including user interviews, assessment of needs, and recommendation of solutions.
 Assist in coordinating with the ITS team to locate data errors, find solutions and resolve the errors.
 Assist in validating data exported from Trapeze FX and used in various systems including ORBCAD ( ITS ) and UTA ( APC ).
 Assist in various project management functions.
 Perform related duties as required and/or assigned.

Minimum Qualifications-Education and Experience
 Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Economics, Planning, Statistics, Geography or a similar field. Related experience may substitute on a year-for-year basis up to four (4) years.
 Four (4) years of experience in transit scheduling, planning, operations, business analysis or data analysis.
 Experience with Microsoft Office Suite applications including Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook.
 Experience using various Scheduling and ITS (Intelligent Transportation Systems) such as Trapeze FX, ORBCAD and Automatic Passenger Counter ( APC ) data preferred.
 Experience with database software.
 Experience in data collection and analysis.

Minimum Qualifications-Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
 Ability to utilize database software at an advanced level, including creation of macros and modules.
 Knowledge of statistical processes.
 Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills, including skill in interviewing a variety of individuals for information gathering purposes.
 Ability to identify problems, propose solutions, and to coordinate diverse job requirements/projects on very tight schedules.
 Ability to work in a confined, time restrained and stressful environment.
 Excellent time management, task and detail oriented skills.
 Ability to develop, learn and retain new skills quickly.
 Ability to be flexible and can adjust quickly to changes as required.
 Ability to interact efficiently and effectively with other team members or departments.
 Knowledge of and dedication to customer service and working team concepts.

Additional Position Information
CAPITAL METRO IS AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER .

Salary Range
$22.90 to $28.62 /HR

Purpose As part of multi-disciplinary, integrated research teams, the candidate will develop research avenues in using data analytics tools in the areas of hydrology and water/energy.

Essential Functions Conduct research in state of the art hydrologic issues using desired skills in big data analytics, artificial intelligence, statistical tools, and machine learning using multiple programming platforms. Assist research team(s) in related engineering and hydrologic analyses. Collaborate with team members on program development and fund raising. Present research results in oral and poster formats at local and national meetings. Provide service to professional societies, the Bureau of Economic Geology and the Jackson School of Geosciences. Serve on committees as needed.

Marginal/Incidental functions Other related functions as assigned.

Licenses: Class "C" Operator's Driver's License. Applicant selected must provide a current three year Driving Record from the current state of residence. If not currently a Texas resident, must obtain a Texas Driver's License within 30 days after entering Texas as a new resident.

Required qualifications PhD degree with 3 years of experience or MSc degree with 6 years of experience in Civil/Environmental Engineering, Hydrology or related field with proven skills in big data analytics, artificial intelligence and machine learning. This position will be a member of the SQL Server team within Server Application Hosting & Support. The SQL Team is responsible for the architecture, design, implementation, and support of the global International Paper database environment. Our SQL Server environments are considered an enterprise, strategic platform that directly enables applications utilized by many of the businesses of International Paper. This position will contribute to implementing new systems as well as the overall availability, performance, and maintenance for the SQL Server environment.

Key Accountabilities :
This position will require:
Thorough knowledge of database troubleshooting skills related to SQL Server. This position will be required to successfully diagnosis database related problems and take necessary action in a timely manner. Additionally, this position will require proactive efforts to prevent unplanned outages or additional work.
With no supervision, database patching and upgrade skills will be required for SQL Server environments. This position will be able to successfully apply SQL Server database patches and upgrades to International Papers current database versions.
Database consultation and best practice advice for use of SQL Server Databases. This position will be able to guide application developers, vendors, and users with database advice in usability, capacity planning, and appropriate tools used with the SQL Server environments.
Knowledge and understanding of specific technology used with International Papers SQL Server environment. Operating systems, clustering, and reporting services are a few areas which require specific knowledge and breadth of understanding.
The person fulfilling this position will be expected to work an 8-hour shift, Monday through Friday, on site, at International Papers Southwind facility.
This position, and its level, will be expected to provide some training and mentoring to other team members.
Knowledge of Windows Operating Systems will be required.

The internal environment, including interaction with others, (both inside and outside the company) policies/practices:

Team player and sharing of knowledge is expected. This position requires skills in effectively dealing with ambiguity.
After hour support will be required.
On call rotation of support will be required.
Documentation of best practice tips and publicly publishing these documents will be required.
Customer Focus, maintaining an average Survey Score of 5.2 or greater.
Training and Mentoring of other team members will be required.

The work itself, e.g., problems, opportunities, change:
This position requires an ability to adapt well to personnel, environmental, and technological changes.
Additionally, this position will require documenting lessons learned and publishing to the teams common document repository.

Certain administrative activities will be required throughout each year. Annual objectives, career and development work plans, email correspondence, time tracking, management and team
leader requests will occur. This position will require timely attention and adherence to these processes and requests.

Planned and unplanned project type work will occur. Each employee will be expected to fulfill the tasks assigned to each employee for all approved projects that involve the SQL Team.

The role of this position is non-supervisory, there will no headcount responsibilities. This position will contribute to the availability of software business tools utilized by our businesses. The contributions of this position will be measured through various service agreements with our business partners, annual goals and objectives, and career and development processes.

Knowledge and Experience :
Bachelors degree in Computer Science, or related area

Experience Required in the Following Areas:
Five Years (minimum) SQL Server Administration Experience in a Production Environment.
Version 2016 - Preferred
Version 2014 - Required
High Availability Options with SQL Server
Skilled in Writing and Tuning SQL, T-SQL, and DB stored objects (packages, triggers, etc.)
Thorough Understanding of Backup and Recovery Processes with SQL Server
Thorough Understanding to Identify and Deploy Performance Tuning Improvements with SQL Server
Thorough Understanding of Monitoring Techniques.

Skills Required in the Following Areas:
Problem Solving Skills and a Self Starter
Capacity Planning Skills with hardware, storage, and SQL Server Consolidations
Communications Skills among Fellow Team Members
Documentation Skills
Possess Skills to Maintain 24x7 SQL Server Availability
Knowledge of Oracle or MySQL a plus.

job_title: 2018 Full time: Sam's Technology - Statistical Analyst
summary:
Position Description

Analyzes data to drive analytics projects
Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans
Models compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity
Participates in multiple analytics project teams
Presents data insights to key stakeholders
Provides and supports the implementation of business solutions

Minimum Qualifications

Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 3 years experience in an analytics related field, OR 5 years experience in analytics related field, OR a Masters degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 1 year experience in an analytics related field.

Additional Preferred Qualifications

3 years experience with SQL and relational databases (for example, DB2, Oracle, SQL Server).
3 years experience with statistical programming languages (for example, SAS, R).
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics and 4 years experience in an analytics related field.
Certificate in business analytics, data mining, or statistical analysis.
Master's degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, or Mathematics.

Company Summary
What started small, with a single discount store and the simple idea of selling more for less, has grown over the last 50 years into the largest retailer in the world. Today, nearly 260 million customers visit our more than 11,500 stores under 72 banners in 28 countries and e-commerce sites in 11 countries each week. With fiscal year 2016 revenue of $482.1 billion, Walmart employs 2.3 million associates worldwide  1.5 million in the U.S. alone. Its all part of our unwavering commitment to creating opportunities and bringing value to customers and communities around the world.

In this Business Operations Analyst role, you will work with the Operations Analytics team in Central Engineering. You will be accountable for metrics and reporting for business operations in Central Engineering. You will also be involved in streamlining business processes and collaborating with various functional units in Central Engineering.

What will you be accountable for?

You will aid individual functions and teams by building detailed budgets and collect outcomes in corporate systems. You will track and report overall costs in line with mentorship, enabling forecasting of revenues by combining multiple data sources into a consolidated view. You will develop bespoke data-mining, data-analysis, and reporting for different partners. You will participate in the Operational Planning, which includes management of key objectives, risks, and critical metrics. You will support longer-term business planning activities and handle day-to-day logistics such as supporting the hiring plan.

Job Requirements What skills, experience, and qualifications do you need?
Master's degree in Computer Science/Engineering, Management Information Systems or Business Analytics or related discipline preferred, although other degrees would be considered with relevant professional experience.
Minimum of 18 months of work experience with data analyses and requirements gathering.
Proven numerical and analytical capabilities with a proven programming acumen.
Proven experience in change management with a strong focus on end results and the ability to infuse trust while providing structured plans to partners.
Strong interpersonal skills to enable networking in a dynamic global team/organization.
Proficient with configuration methods, versioning, and documentation tools such as experience working with Microsoft SharePoint sites and other Office 365 collaboration tools.
Proficient with visualization tools(D3, Tableau preferably), MS SQL, programming (Python preferably), SAP ERP and SharePoint.
Experience in developing relationships and networking with key partners in a cross functional global organization.
Autonomous, enthusiastic, self-motivated and welcoming of new challenges.
This position will be require to travel internationally on occasion (20%).
What are the desired behaviors for this role?

At Arm, we are proud to have a set of behaviors that reflect our ambitious culture and guide our decisions, defining how we work together to defy ordinary and craft extraordinary. These behaviors are assessed as part of the recruitment process:
Delivery of results:  You demonstrate a can-do attitude and you aim to overcome obstacles, acting with a sense of urgency because you're passionate about what you do.
Partner / customer focus:  Your tendency to put your partners and customers first in all that you do by understanding their needs and striving to achieve win-win solutions.
Creativity / innovation:  Possessing curiosity and a real passion for driving continuous improvement through spotting opportunities and seeking the views of others.
Collaboration / communication:  Your ability to craft positive relationships which are built upon mutual trust, open communication and sharing of information and success.
Personal impact / influence:  You listen to different perspectives, evaluate, persuade and carefully shape your work to deliver truly impactful results.
Team / personal development:  You take time to drive your own development, while also encouraging team members and partners to do the same

 A healthy appetite of curiosity coupled with creative problem solving

Valued Skills & Experience
 MS Azure or AWS
 Azure Machine Learning
 MS SQL Server 2016
 Spark, SciKit Learn, TensorFlow
 Nonlinear optimization, graph theory

Why Coyote?
 Onsite training & ongoing career development
 Competitive base salary
 Comprehensive benefits package
 Great perks like onsite haircuts, massages, and intramural sports
 Significant advancement opportunities for outstanding performers
 Casual dress and company lunch

Overview Do you want to use Analytics to help companies better understand their customers?

Companies understand all about their sales by store, region, product, department and season. In todays environment, this is not enough. An understanding of their customers is essential. At Wunderman, we help companies understand their customers shopping patterns  How often do they shop? What channels do they use? What do they buy together? What are their trip drivers? How valuable is a Direct Mail contact compared to an email? How do they use the web and interact with social media? WB Games Inc. is seeking a Game Data Analyst to join our San Francisco Studio. The Game Data Analyst will work directly with Product Management to own the game data creation, transformation, modelling, and visualization process for all studio titles; which comprises of a growing multi-million dollar live portfolio, and hundreds of thousands of daily active users.

The ideal candidate has a background of partnering directly with Product Managers in order to perform statistical analysis to research and predict user behaviour and in-game events to drive sustained engagement and monetization. They have a strong background of working with an internal data warehouse that supports state-of-the-art analytics and they must have an affinity for data and analytics that support key business decisions.

The successful candidate thrives at delivering solutions to complex data problems preferably in gaming but with an unashamed passion for games/gamers, and has proven themselves effective at navigating and overcoming both internal and external challenges. Reporting to the Director of Product Management, this role is crucial to attaining Warner Bros. aggressive goals in mobile games.

What Part Will You Play?
Own instrumentation of analytics, tracking hooks, and taxonomy during development phase; establish best practices for repeated application.
Work with Product Management & central analytics team to manage 3rd party tool integration.
Design, create, monitor and maintain performance indicator dashboards across studio portfolio.
Work closely with Studio Principal Engineer to find solutions to integrate & automate data logging triggers on client/server code wherever possible.
Work closely with Studio Principal Engineer to perform basic statistical analysis to research and predict user behavior and in-game events.
Work closely with Studio Principal Engineer on Machine learning initiatives.
Work with Product Management to generate actionable reports and recommendations on features that will improve retention, monetization and acquisition of gamers.
Work with PM to generate BI/MI reports at all levels from team.
Identify pain points and work with product management, design and product development to implement strategies to address key problem areas.
Suggest, execute and analyze the effectiveness of A/B tests.
Establish game data/data science foundation within the SF studio, work closely with our internal platform team, game teams, and third party vendors to establish best practices.
Documentation of analysis/code/scripts.
What Do We Require From You?
MA/MS Degree in Quantitative Analysis, Statistics, Computer Science, Operations Research, Economics, Mathematics or related field preferred.
Minimum 2-3 years experience in data and analytics-intensive role. Mobile, social or online games experience a plus.
Deep familiarity with iOS, Android, or Facebook games marketplaces, design trends and analytics best practices.
Experience writing queries and using software tools to put together reports and analysis to drive key business decision-making.
Experience with using R or Python for statistical analysis.
Ability to promote analytics across the organization and lead teams to using analytics insights to drive decisions.
Proven ability to conceive and test hypotheses based on inconclusive or incomplete data from unstructured data and creating structures that lend themselves to analysis.
Strong analytical background with a focus on consumer behavior in digital entertainment/games.
Comfortable presenting complicated material to diverse audiences; strong soft skills.
Strong PC Skills, including proficiency with MS Outlook, Word, and Excel.
Proven SQL skills  Must be experienced writing queries across complex database structures Distributed querying experience (Hive/Pig/Presto) a huge plus!
Experience with using Tableau or Looker.
2 years of experience with using R or Python for statistical analysis.
Exceptional PowerPoint presentation skills.
Must have excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to collaborate with colleagues across different disciplines and locations to achieve results.
Ability to work in a fast-pace environment and prioritize work to meet specific deadlines required.
Must be self-motivated and results oriented.
Attendance at industry conferences as required.
Passion for gaming!

Economic and Financial Modeling specialist in the field of Pay for Success and Social Impact Finance at the Sorenson Impact Center. Prepares complex economic and financial models, analyzes data, and conducts sensitivity analysis.

The Business Data Analyst, Economic and Financial modeling specialist will join a highly-motivated team working in the field of Pay for Success, social impact investment and finance and will be responsible for gathering, interpreting and analyzing data and building complex economic and financial excel models.

This position includes building complex spreadsheet models, gathering and analyzing appropriate data for the models, determining the best approach to complete a project or address a problem, obtaining valid data and creating clear and understandable reports that reflect the data being sought.

Responsibilities
1. Prepares and interprets economic and financial excel models.
2. Analyzes statistical data, historical data and presents to and interprets for team members, stakeholders and clients.
3. Participates in presentations of economic and financial models to clients.
4. Analyzes trends and possible consequences.

5. May provide training on economic and financial modeling financial or provide guidance to more junior staff and students.
6. Work with stakeholders to acquire, validate and analyze aggregate and or individual level data.
7. Research existing literature relevant to project outcomes and benefit-cost analysis.
8. Prepare written summaries of results of economic and financial models to be included in reports and presentations.
9. Other duties as assigned.

This job description is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to the job.

Minimum Qualifications
Requires a bachelors degree in related area (2 years related work experience may be substituted for 1 year of education). Two to four years of experience in the field or in a related area. Familiar with standard concepts, practices, and procedures within a particular field.

Applicants must demonstrate the potential ability to perform the essential functions of the job as outlined in the position description.

Preferences
Bachelors degree or graduate major demonstrating strong analytical and quantitative competency (math, economics, engineering, science, statistics, or other similar disciplines); Minimum of two years of prior experience in building economic and/or financial excel spreadsheet models. Candidates with extensive work experience in building economic and financial excel models without a BA in the majors listed above will also be considered; advanced excel spreadsheet skills; knowledge of statistics and demonstrated analytical, problem solving, human relation and effective communication skills required. Experience with analyzing data sets.

Benefited Staff

Courtney , Data Science
About the position

Join Zocdoc in building a dynamic marketplace to dramatically improve the healthcare experience for both patients and doctors. As a data scientist, your research is at the heart of our mission. You will explore key business and product questions, communicate insights, and drive cutting-edge research. U sing a variety of data mining and analysis methods, you will build and implement models to create algorithms, run simulations, and test your results. We are looking for a statistically-minded individual who has the coding skills to independently work with data and interpret research outcomes to determine company strategy. A close collaboration with business partners (including product, engineering, marketing, and sales) will enable you to implement data-driven initiatives. You will explore fundamental questions like what interventions can influence people to make more regular preventative visits to their doctor; and, what makes a doctor successful on Zocdoc.

What Youll Do:
Research core business and product questions, using both internal and external data sets
Apply advanced statistical techniques to measure efficacy of various product, marketing, and patient outreach efforts
Communicate insights to business owners
Support data-driven decision making/AB tests (experiment design, analysis, reporting) for execs, business owners, product managers, engineers, etc.
Evangelize data usage and logging (understand data provenance and work to maintain/improve data integrity)
Promote the adoption of best-practices in data processing tools/techniques
Whats Required:
4+ years of experience performing data analysis; or a Master's degree or PhD in statistics, math, engineering, physical sciences, computer science, or another quantitative discipline
Expertise working with SQL, a scripting language (Python, Scala, and/or R), and distributed computed (Spark)
Advanced understanding of statistics, experimental design, and common machine learning techniques
Experience working with business partners to coordinate research objectives, manage a research plan, and present results
Ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance
What you'll get:
A competitive compensation package
A home at one of the best places to work in NYC
100% employer-covered health insurance and a flexible vacation policy
An incredible team of smart and supportive people
The chance to create a better healthcare experience for millions of patients!

Further, our data analysts work closely with our research teams, developing meaningful insight into a fascinating industry and contributing to our private equity, venture capital and M&A research. Our team is creative, driven and focused on providing the most accurate and digestible data to our clients daily.

1-3 years experience in financial services role or experience working with large datasets

Experience using Python or other programming languages a plus
Strong interest in M&A and private financial markets
Critical thinker
Detail oriented / analytical mindset

At PitchBook, we work tirelessly to arm professionals within the global private equity and venture capital industries with the finest data, technology and service so they can make the most informed business decisions efficiently. This is accomplished through our award-winning product, the PitchBook Platform, along with a powerful suite of integrated tools to meet the diverse data-driven needs of our clients. Its a very collaborative, client focused environment with a culture that is driven towards excellence and getting things done.

Salisbury University, a member of the University System of Maryland, is a regionally accredited four-year comprehensive institution offering 58 distinct graduate and undergraduate programs. This is a full-time, exempt, 12 month, contingent II position with limited benefits. Salary will be commensurate with experience and qualifications. While the position will be an employee of Salisbury University, it will be based in Crownsville, Maryland .

Taboola is headquartered in New York City, and also has offices across the globe in Los Angeles, London, Tel Aviv, New Delhi, Bangkok, So Paulo, Shanghai, Beijing, Seoul, Istanbul, and Tokyo.
